Job Description

Nice-Pak Products, Inc. (NP) is the global developer, manufacturer and marketer of pre-moistened wipes for the consumer market, specializing in personal care, hygiene, household cleaning and disinfection products. We have several locations across the US
and are looking for new Associates to join our team!

POSITION PURPOSE:

This is a 12 hour rotating shift, working 6 pm - 6 am, on a 2-2-3 schedule.

Associate is responsible for safe, efficient line stocking and warehousing of raw materials. This position reports to the Warehouse Supervisor. This position will be expected to complete required training to advance to a Warehouse Operator within set timeframe.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES:
  • Unload inbound shipments safely using proper equipment and procedures. Move product to storage locations and efficiently stack and place product in the appropriate area.
  • Stage product in advance of loading to ensure accuracy with quantities and codes, and to optimize the live loading schedule.
  • Relocate product as directed by Supervisor, Lead or Clerk to efficiently utilize available warehouse space.
  • Pick orders as directed and prepare shipments in safe and efficient manner using proper equipment and procedures.
  • Load outbound freight in a safe and efficient manner using proper equipment and procedures.
  • Load, unload, move, stack and stage product using fork truck, clamp truck, or other powered equipment. Inspect and perform routine maintenance daily. Operate all equipment in a safe and efficient manner.
  • Conduct physical inventories as required.
  • Maintain a neat, clean, and orderly work area. Assist in maintaining the security of the warehouse. Conduct operations in a manner consistent with Company Safety policies.
  • Perform or assist in building, grounds, and equipment maintenance as required.
  • Adhere to all Company Safety work rules, policies, procedures and cGMPs.
  • Consistently pass required forklift testing and safety training.
  • Perform various tasks on all equipment when necessary, using proper safety equipment and procedures.
  • Perform all other duties as assigned.
The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance job this position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive list or statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements.

PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS:
  • Meet or exceed Quality, Safety, and Productivity goals set for the line centers
  • Timely and accurate completion of production batch records
  • Effective verbal and written communication with supporting departments to adhere to the production
Requirements

EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION:
  • High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent experience.
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE:
  • Capable to do simple math
  • Have good handwriting skills
  • Ability to safety operate a lift truck and to pass certification
  • Ability to follow directions
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
  • Previous experience in warehouse functions and previous experience in a distribution center environment
  • Previous computer / RF experience / WMS preferred
  • Minimum 1-3 years of experience operating a sit down forklift truck.
SKILLS/ABILITIES:
  • Have and maintain good attendance record.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
  • Fast paced manufacturing environment

AC2019

Manages activities of at least one warehouse supervisor or 2 or more other warehouse employees to optimize service, productivity and quality and minimize expenses; direct, organize, check work and schedule, direct and control job assignments; ensure warehouse processes are clearly documented, the workplace is safe, employees receive appropriate training, and performance management issues are addressed promptly. In conjunction with Human Resources, has authority to hire, fire, discipline, promote, reassign, determine pay increases, or conduct performance management of employees.
Detailed Description
* Coordinates employee work assignments to achieve inbound and outbound service requirements.
* Directs achievement of performance objectives related to productivity, quality, service and safety.
* Performs administrative or logistical management duties in support of warehouse operation, including reconciliation of cycle count disparities, analysis of purchase orders vs. inventory received, job scheduling, inventory logistics, receiving reports, audits, etc.
* Monitors workflow, work completed, error rates and related metrics and take corrective action.
* Ensures procedures are observed, implemented and enforced.
* Ensures quality and inspection process is accurate and excess costs are eliminated.
* Ensures safe working environment and follow safety regulations.
* Ensures warehouse employees receive training.
* Ensures accurate time, attendance, and performance management records are maintained.
* Maintains positive employee relations and morale.
* With assistance from human resources, carries out performance management actions, including hiring, firing, discipline and setting of pay rates for employees.
* Assists in developing and documenting warehouse processes.
* Establishes and monitors performance standards for warehouse functions, including pick, pack, and ship.
* Processes returned merchandise.
* Establishes and monitors performance standards for equipment, assembly, housekeeping, etc.
* Develops and implements training certification programs.Job Requirements

Supervision in warehouse environment - 1 to 3 years required; 5 years preferred.

High School Diploma or equivalent required.

Strong knowledge of inventory control processes.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong time management skills.
Basic computer skills.
Attention to detail.

Working Environment:
* Warehouse - Work is generally performed in a warehouse environment. The noise level is moderately quiet. Generally well ventilated and well lighted. Warehouse employees may be exposed to all kinds of weather and may be required to wear protective clothing. Operates heavy equipment. Strict safety regulations may be required.
physical requirements:
* Work is physically strenuous and workers are required to lift heavy packages up to 50 pounds.
* Work may require excessive bending or stooping.
* Employee required to walk long distances repeatedly throughout the day.
* Employee required to climb ladders.
* Employee required to use hand tools.
* Employee uses heavy machinery (e.g., forklift, etc.).
mental requirements:
* Employee required to organize and coordinate schedules.
* Employee required to problem-solve.
* Employee required to manage other employees.

Manages activities of at least one warehouse supervisor or 2 or more other warehouse employees to optimize service, productivity and quality and minimize expenses; direct, organize, check work and schedule, direct and control job assignments; ensure warehouse processes are clearly documented, the workplace is safe, employees receive appropriate training, and performance management issues are addressed promptly. In conjunction with Human Resources, has authority to hire, fire, discipline, promote, reassign, determine pay increases, or conduct performance management of employees.

* Coordinates employee work assignments to achieve inbound and outbound service requirements.

AC2019

Job Description

Job Summary
Responsible for order shipment coordination and verification of SOH product and distributor products.? Maintains day to day operations within the warehouse.? Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in verifying and keeping records on incoming and outgoing shipments, preparing items for receipt, shipment and storage by performing the following duties.
?
Essential Job Duties
?
  • Studies shipping notices, bills of lading, invoices, orders and other records to determine shipping priorities, work assignments, and shipping methods required to meet shipping and receiving schedules.
  • Oversees incoming and outgoing shipping activities to ensure accuracy, completeness, and condition of shipments.
  • Inspects material handling equipment for defects and notifies appropriate personnel for repair.
  • Directs movement of shipments from shipping and receiving platform to storage and work areas including managing and directing employees in loading and unloading trailers of palletized and non-palletized products.
  • Responsible to maintain and the warehouse in an efficient organized manner.
  • Manages inventory and maintains accurate inventory records.
  • Maintains area in accordance with all internal and external regulatory guidelines, i.e., OSHA, FDA, PDA, DOT, etc.
  • Manages the recording systems for amounts of materials or items received or distributed.
  • Adjusts errors and complaints.
  • Manages and directs staff in cycle count inventory of all merchandise; records counts on cycle count sheets and adjusts inventory in system accordingly.
  • Must be able to get along well with others.
  • Must be able to prioritize and manage several tasks at once.
  • Practices and adheres to appropriate safety and hygiene guidelines/procedures for safe housekeeping and personal protection; keeps work area clean; stores supplies in designated areas; keeps work area aisles/exits clear and free from obstructions; removes trash from work area floor; follows instructions for safe lifting/carrying of various sizes, shapes, and weights:? identifies/reports defective equipment; reports all job-related injuries to supervision.
?

Scope of Responsibility
Directly supervises 2 or more employees in the DSD Warehouse Division.? Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
?
Supervisory Responsibility ?
Directly supervises 2 or more employees in the DSD Warehouse Division.? Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
?
Knowledge and Skill Requirements
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
?
Language Skills
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical
procedures or governmental regulations.? Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and
procedure manuals.? Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of
managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
?
Mathematical Skills
Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and
fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry.? Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
?
Reasoning Ability
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
?
Certificates, Licenses, Registrations
Ability to qualify for fork lift licenses.? Ability to qualify for C-class licenses, depending on state laws. Must have a valid driver's license.
?
Competencies

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
?
Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data; Designs work flows and procedures.
?
Design - Generates creative solutions; Translates concepts and information into images; Uses feedback to modify designs; Applies design principles; Demonstrates attention to detail.
?
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
?
Project Management - Develops project plans; Coordinates projects; Communicates changes and progress; Completes projects on time and budget; Manages project team activities.
?
Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.
?
Interpersonal Skills - Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.
?
Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings.
?
Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.
?
Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
?
Delegation - Delegates work assignments; Matches the responsibility to the person; Gives authority to work independently; Sets expectations and monitors delegated activities; Provides recognition for results.
?
Leadership - Exhibits confidence in self and others; Inspires and motivates others to perform well; Effectively influences actions and opinions of others; Accepts feedback from others; Gives appropriate recognition to others.
?
Managing People - Includes staff in planning, decision-making, facilitating and process improvement; Takes responsibility for subordinates' activities; Makes self available to staff; Provides regular performance feedback; Develops subordinates' skills and encourages growth; Solicits and applies customer feedback (internal and external); Fosters quality focus in others; Improves processes, products and services.; Continually works to improve supervisory skills.
?
Business Acumen - Understands business implications of decisions; Displays orientation to profitability; Demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; Aligns work with strategic goals.
?
Cost Consciousness - Works within approved budget; Develops and implements cost saving measures; Contributes to profits and revenue; Conserves organizational resources.
?
Diversity - Demonstrates knowledge of EEO policy; Shows respect and sensitivity for cultural differences; Educates others on the value of diversity; Promotes a harassment-free environment; Builds a diverse workforce.
?
Ethics - Treats people with respect; Keeps commitments; Inspires the trust of others; Works with integrity and ethically; Upholds organizational values.
?
Organizational Support - Follows policies and procedures; Completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; Supports organization's goals and values; Benefits organization through outside activities; Supports affirmative action and respects diversity.
?
Strategic Thinking - Develops strategies to achieve organizational goals; Understands organization's strengths & weaknesses; Analyzes market and competition; Identifies external threats and opportunities; Adapts strategy to changing conditions.
?
Judgment - Displays willingness to make decisions; Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Supports and explains reasoning for decisions; Includes appropriate people in decision-making process; Makes timely decisions.
?
Motivation - Sets and achieves challenging goals; Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; Measures self against standard of excellence; Takes calculated risks to accomplish goals.
?
Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Plans for additional resources; Sets goals and objectives; Organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; Develops realistic action plans.
?..... click apply for full job details

AC2019

Job Description

WAREHOUSE MANAGER - Herndon, VA
Dynamic company seeks Warehouse Manager to embark on a successful career in our Herndon, VA branch. Motivated and energetic people with a sense of urgency will have the chance to join Ram Tool Construction Supply Co., the largest family-owned distributor of specialty commercial construction supplies in the Mid-Atlantic, Southeast, and Texas. Ram Tool has a vast product line with 90,000+ unique items to sell and over 90% of deliveries made within 24 hours.
Reporting directly to the Branch Operations Manager, the Warehouse Manager is responsible for managing all functions of warehousing.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Management of warehouse personnel (1-6 team members, depending on branch)
  • Cycle Counting to ensure inventory accuracy
  • Project Lead for multi-functions within the warehouse setting
  • Dispatch Assistance- loading and unloading of vehicles, dispatching of drivers (3-15 team members)
  • Warehouse Assistance- pulling and staging orders
  • Responsible for following all safety rules and regulations including the following:
      • Safety Meetings and reporting
      • Forklift Inspection and reports
      • Maintain a clean and safe environment within a warehouse setting
  • Support of Operations Manager - multi-task alongside these individuals as well as comply with all rules and regulations in respect to the Management requirements
  • Perform other duties to support inventory management/ procurement efforts as assigned
REQUIREMENTS:
  • High School Diploma (or equivalent)
  • College Degree or some years of college preferred
  • Minimum 2 years warehouse management experience
  • Ability to manage a small team of people
  • Knowledge of computer fundamentals including Microsoft Office and inventory management software, spreadsheets, design plans/layouts
  • SAP experience is a plus
  • Must pass drug screen and background check
  • Forklift certified/ certifiable
  • Ability to lift over 50 lbs. and assisted safe lifting of larger items
  • Might be required to be on feet for a long period of time
For a more detailed job description click here.
* Standard Drug screen, Driving Record and Background Checks will be performed.
RAM TOOL IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Job Description

Job Description:

Leidos is seeking a Warehouse/Shipping/Receiving Manager in Elkridge, Maryland. This role will be responsible for the oversight of shipping and receiving of all goods and materials in support of the Cyber and SIGINT Solutions Operation. Duties may include using computer system for tracking, logging, verifying and reporting as well as receiving incoming materials or preparing materials for shipment. Will lead and manage all aspects of a 18,000 sq. ft. warehouse to include vendor communication, shipping, receiving, fleet management and oversight of two warehouse personnel. The candidate will be expected to work independently to achieve day-to-day objectives with significant impact on operational results or project deliverables. While security clearance is not required for the position, government/military experience is a plus.

This position typically requires a BA degree and 4 - 8 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2 - 6 years of prior relevant experience (12 years of relevant logistics experience may be substituted for education). Experience should include a full understanding of concepts, principles including a deep understanding of industry practices and standards. A Commercial Driver's License (CDL) is required.

Full and Part Time Positions available!

As a Warehouse Fulfillment Specialist at a local client you will hand pick orders, pack and label merchandise for shipment, and transport products within a warehouse environment.

Primary Responsibilities Include:
  • Picking orders and placing items on conveyors
  • Working in a team environment to efficiently package required orders
  • Handling finished materials and moving packages to storage areas within the warehouse
  • Building and stretching wrap pallets
  • Operating carts, dollies, and other moving equipment to move large quantities of merchandise

  • Must have reliable transportation and good attendance
  • Ability to stand for entire shift and walk throughout the warehouse
  • Pay attention to detail while picking orders and packing items for shipping
The starting pay rate for Warehouse Fulfillment jobs is $11.00-11.25/hr, plus overtime as needed.

At Adecco, we are the workforce experts providing work opportunities to individuals across all industries. Every day, we have more than 100,000 associates on assignment, and our 30,000 internal colleagues are working hard to help our candidates find jobs and advance their careers. As a Warehouse Fulfillment Specialist at a local client you will hand pick orders, pack and label merchandise for shipment, and transport products within a warehouse environment.

Primary Responsibilities Include:
  • Picking orders and placing items on conveyors
  • Working in a team environment to efficiently package required orders
  • Handling finished materials and moving packages to storage areas within the warehouse
  • Building and stretching wrap pallets
  • Operating carts, dollies, and other moving equipment to move large quantities of merchandise

  • Must have reliable transportation and good attendance
  • Ability to stand for entire shift and walk throughout the warehouse
  • Pay attention to detail while picking orders and packing items for shipping
The starting pay rate for Warehouse Fulfillment jobs is $11.00-11.50/hr, plus overtime as needed.

We have 1st and 2nd shift available and can help you choose the best shift to fit your schedule!

At Adecco, we care about our associates' well being on the job and off, which is why we offer the following benefits:
  • Medical, dental, and vision plans
  • Paid Holidays
  • 401(k) Plan
  • Skills Training
  • Referral Bonuses
  • Weekly pay with direct deposit or pay card
  • After 100 hours you will be eligible for a $100.00 bonus!

Uline is seeking Warehouse Associates to join us at our Lacey branch.

Our minimum starting wage is $19.50.
_______________________________________________________________

Warehouse Associate / Material Handler
Position Responsibilities / Minimum Requirements

  • Ensure order accuracy.

  • Knowledge of warehouse procedures.
  • Inventory Control and Product Slotting experience a plus.
  • Strong problem-solving skills.

Why is Turn 14 Distribution Hiring?

As the leading wholesale distributor of aftermarket performance automotive parts, the drive to be the best is in the fiber of our being. We are searching for positive and dedicated associates to assist in picking, packing, stocking, shipping, receiving, checking inventory, and cycle counting our products. We want candidates who are excited to grow, forward-focused, and driven to meet our daily deadlines. Are you up to the task?

Who's an Ideal Applicant?
  • Thrives in an energetic, fast-paced environment
  • Loves working with details and staying organized
  • Cares and wants to be the best at their job
  • Wants to drive their own road to success
What about Growth Opportunities?

Turn 14 Distribution promotes from within, as we want our leaders to have a complete understanding of how our company is successful. Employees who are driven, outstanding, and care about doing a great job every day will be successful here.

What do I Need to be Successful?
  • At least one year of experience as a warehouse associate
  • Knowledge of inventory, shipping, and receiving, or fulfillment centers
  • Ability to lift 50 or more pounds
  • Available to work between 10:00 AM and 8:00 PM
What does Turn 14 Distribution Offer?
  • Competitive Pay Structure
  • Company-Sponsored Insurance: Medical, Dental, Flexible Spending Accounts, and Dependent Care Accounts
  • Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
  • 401(K) Match
  • Company-Sponsored Events
  • Subsidized Part Purchasing Program

job.description:
Job Description

For 70 years, Kelly Services has provided outstanding employment opportunities to the most talented individuals in the marketplace. Today, we are proud to offer temporary contract 1st shift Warehouse/Distribution Associate positions for a top Pharmaceutical Company in Shepherdsville, KY.
NO EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!
Job Title: Warehouse/Distribution Associate
Location: Shepherdsville, KY
Pay Rate: $15.00/hr. (yearly $.50 raise)
Shift Options: both include 45 minute lunch & two 15 minute breaks.
  • 8hrs: 8:30am - 5:00pm
    • Monday-Friday
  • 10hrs: 6:30 am - 5:00 pm.
    • either Mon-Thu or Tue-Fri.
Duration of Assignment: 2-year contract through Kelly Services.
Additional Info: Must be comfortable working in both Cold Storage & Room Temp departments
Duties:
  • The Distribution/Warehouse Associate is dedicated towards the accurate and timely distribution of pharmaceutical products, raw materials/components, samples, and literature.
  • Responsible for picking, packing, shipping and receiving, inventory, cycle counts, and put-away and loading/unloading.
  • Maintains relationships with distribution and customer service areas, follows regulatory and safety procedures, and performs assignments with necessary technology and equipment.
  • Must be able to attain PIV requirement Certification
    • Previous Forklift Experience Preferred
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORKING CONDITIONS:
  • Physical Demand: Position requires moderate physical demand i.e., continuous lifting and/or moving light weight material (5-25 lbs) and frequent lifting or moving average weight material (25-50 lbs).
  • Mental and Visual Demand: Position requires continuous mental and visual attention to ensure a safe working environment and to meet customer requirements for accurate, on-time, damage free shipments.
  • Working Conditions: The Distribution environment may include areas of controlled and seasonally influenced temperatures. May work in a distribution building with room temperatures and/or cold chain building. Noise exposure may also vary with assignments and distribution activity. Although housekeeping is at a high level, there is possible exposure to dust and dirt due to incoming materials. (May need to work in Cold Environments)
This position is recruited for by a remote Kelly office, not your local Kelly branch.

Job Description

WAREHOUSE ASSOCIATE - Raleigh, NC

Dynamic company seeks a Warehouse Associate to embark on a successful career in our Raleigh, NC branch. Motivated and energetic people with a sense of urgency will have the chance to join Ram Tool Construction Supply Co., the largest family-owned distributor of specialty commercial construction supplies in the Mid-Atlantic, Southeast, and Texas. Ram Tool has a vast product line with 90,000+ unique items to sell and over 90% of deliveries made within 24 hours.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Provides customer service assistance, including pulling and staging orders
  • Performs bin location maintenance
  • Performs tasks to ensure safety, organization and cleanliness of the warehouse environment
  • Assists in conducting Cycle Counting to insure inventory accuracy
  • Attends safety training and meetings. Follows rules and regulations
  • Assists in the compliance of all OSHA/DOT regulations that are applicable, to include inspections, forms, reports, etc.
  • Performs forklift inspections and completes reports
  • Maintains a clean and safe warehouse environment
  • Communicate consistently with management, all branch personnel, and customers
  • May perform Shipping and Receiving functions, including the following:
    • Verifying inventory against purchase orders for accuracy
    • Receiving inventory into the SAP software system
    • Staging / Shelving inventory
    • Shipping inventory to customers
  • Perform other duties as directed by Ram Tool management
DETAILS:
  • Monday through Friday (occasional Saturdays)
  • No CDL required
REQUIREMENTS:
  • High School Diploma (or equivalent)
  • Ability to use Ram Tool's inventory management computer software system, SAP
  • Ability to use warehouse layouts for planning purposes
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel is a plus
  • Basic general computer skills
  • Must have a 'can do, roll your sleeves up, and get it done' attitude
  • Ability to establish priorities, work independently, and proceed with objectives without supervision
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multitask constantly shifting priorities
  • Excellent communication skills
For a more detailed job description click here.
* Standard Drug screen, Driving Record and Background Checks will be performed.
RAM TOOL IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Ram Tool has a vast product line with 90,000+ unique items to sell and over 90% of deliveries made within 24 hours.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Provides customer service assistance, including pulling and staging orders
  • Performs bin location maintenance
  • Performs tasks to ensure safety, organization and cleanliness of the warehouse environment
  • Assists in conducting Cycle Counting to insure inventory accuracy
  • Attends safety training and meetings. Follows rules and regulations
  • Assists in the compliance of all OSHA/DOT regulations that are applicable, to include inspections, forms, reports, etc.
  • Performs forklift inspections and completes reports
  • Maintains a clean and safe warehouse environment
  • Communicate consistently with management, all branch personnel, and customers
  • May perform Shipping and Receiving functions, including the following:
    • Verifying inventory against purchase orders for accuracy
    • Receiving inventory into the SAP software system
    • Staging / Shelving inventory
    • Shipping inventory to customers
  • Perform other duties as directed by Ram Tool management
DETAILS:
  • Monday through Friday (occasional Saturdays)
  • No CDL required
REQUIREMENTS:
  • High School Diploma (or equivalent)
  • Ability to use Ram Tool's inventory management computer software system, SAP
  • Ability to use warehouse layouts for planning purposes
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel is a plus
  • Basic general computer skills
  • Must have a 'can do, roll your sleeves up, and get it done' attitude
  • Ability to establish priorities, work independently, and proceed with objectives without supervision
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multitask constantly shifting priorities
  • Excellent communication skills

AC2019

Job Description

Warehouse Associate (Manufacturing / Production / Staffing)

NEW BENEFITS FOR 2019!

Comprehensive vision plan included with medical plan

Free teledoctor and telecounseling

$5 doctor visit copay (first 2 visits)

$5 generic prescription copay

Metlife Dental Plan,

plus Vacation Pay and Holiday Pay

Here at the Onin Group we don't define you by the length of your assignment. People are our business, so we need each other to survive and thrive. Whether you have worked with us for two days or two years, you are part of the team. In order to attract and retain the best talent there must be a win-win relationship-therefore, we offer a liberal vacation and holiday pay plan, robust healthcare benefits, bonus programs and even a scholarship for continuing education. But the true difference is in how we view our workforce. We believe that people are a responsibility, not a commodity. With Onin you are not a "temp"-you are a teammate. Contact us today!

Warehouse Associate / Order Picker

Job Responsibilities

As a Warehouse Associate, you will perform production packing and assembly work for a warehouse or production company. You may also have some light shipping duties, and depending upon your assignment, you may be working with a conveyor belt.

Your specific duties may include:
  • Sorting
  • Order Picking
  • Performing light quality control to ensure that products are going to the correct areas
  • Performing general cleanup and maintenance of your work area
  • Meeting or exceeding all production goals on a consistent basis
Warehouse Associate / Order Picker

We are looking for Warehouse Associates who are reliable and safety-minded, with a strong work ethic. You should also be highly organized with strong communication and interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to work effectively as part of a team.

Specific qualifications for the role include:
  • High school diploma or GED
  • Minimum 2 years of hands on warehouse experience (such as assembly, machine operation, order puller, stocking, or shipping and receiving)
  • Ability to stand, bend, and stoop for long periods of time
  • Ability to lift 25-50 pounds repeatedly
  • Ability to pass a background check and drug screen
Warehouse Associate (Manufacturing / Production / Staffing)

The Onin Group - We Don't Hire Temps, We Hire Teammates

Apply now!

AC2019

Job Description

The Warehouse Operator is responsible for operation of material handling equipment for the purpose of accurate shipping, processing and receiving, which includes but is not limited to unloading, scanning, moving, staging, loading, locating, picking, relocating, and stacking product.

?

CORE JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Receives inbound materials and marks materials with identifying information; record amount of material received; sort materials and stock on racks, shelves or bins in accordance with predetermined sequence such as size, color, type, or product code. Arrange materials for order assembly.
  • Reads production schedule, order forms (customer, work, and/or shipping), or requisitions to determine items to be moved, gathered, or distributed. Compiles worksheets or tickets from customer specifications. Convey materials within warehouse to appropriate department (shipping, production and/or storage), in accordance with schedule and operating procedures.
  • Fills requisitions, work orders, or requests for materials, tools or other stock items and distributes items to production workers or assembly line.
  • Assembles customer orders from stock and places on pallets or shelves, or conveys orders to packing station or shipping department.
  • Operates hand truck, cart, doilies, forklift, order-picker, and walkie to transport stored items from warehouse to plant or to pick up items for shipment.
  • Housekeeping duties including all forms of warehouse cleanup.
?Qualifications:?
  • Ability to speak, read, and write English with proficiency.
  • Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence and memos.
  • Basic keypunch skills.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:?

Education
  • High school diploma or General Education Degree (GED)
Relevant Work Experience
  • 1-3 months related experience and/or training

AC2019

Iron Mountain Incorporated (NYSE: IRM), founded in 1951 and ranked as a Forbes 2018 America’s Best Employers, is the global leader for storage and information management services. Trusted by more than 225,000 organizations around the world, Iron Mountain stores and protects billions of valued assets, including critical business information, highly sensitive data, and cultural and historical artifacts. Providing solutions that include information management, digital transformation, secure storage, secure destruction, data centers, cloud services and art storage and logistics, Iron Mountain helps customers lower cost and risk, comply with regulations, recover from disaster, and enable a digital way of working. Visit www.ironmountain.com for more information.
Responsibilities
Our Warehouse Associates are the backbone to Iron Mountain. They are responsible for keeping our warehouse organized, neat and processing items in a timely manner. They must keep a positive attitude at all times and be ready to adapt to any changes and hit the ground running on the position.
Warehouse work: Packing and picking
Consistent, Predictable Shifts
Competitive Hourly Pay
Biweekly pay schedule
Company Paid Uniforms and Safety Footwear
Qualifications
Job Requirements
·Prepare for and complete warehouse tasks such as picking items that have a large volume and/ or furniture items while showing a positive attitude
·Pack, wrap, and mark items to protect items while in transport and storage
·Working with the operations manager to develop best practices for moving, storing, and organizing larger items
·Occasionally help the teams on the field by providing great customer service
·You must be able to lift heavy items (25 to 100 lbs)
·You're flexible to work weekends as needed
Every Iron Mountain employee has an obligation to promptly report issues and violations.

Compliance Obligations:
It is the responsibility of every Iron Mountain employee:
·to comply with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and company policies
·to exhibit ethical behavior in accordance with our Code of Ethics and Business Conduct
·to complete required training within the allotted time frameIron Mountain is an equal opportunity employer, and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity characteristics or expression, disability, medical condition, U.S. Military or veteran status or other legally protected classifications in making employment decisions.

Job Description

Central Pet Distribution is hiring Warehouse Associates! Day Shift Monday ? Friday
Do you love pets and love working in a fast-paced environment? Our growing company is seeking experienced warehouse associates to pull merchandise to complete orders from pick tickets, and load/unload trucks with pet supply products to be delivered to pet retailers. Our Pet Distribution team works together to supply our customers with the nation?s top brands of pet supplies. If you are dependable, responsible and committed to safety, this may be the job for you!
Location: Central Pet Distribution Center in Atlanta, Georgia
Shift Details: Day Shift starting at 7:00am ? 3:30pm, 5-day work week Monday through Friday. Overtime and Saturdays may be required as needed.?
MEASURES OF SUCCESS:
  • Process transactions utilizing RF technology and/or identify items on paper pick ticket according to bin location, part number, and/or description
  • Pick orders that are scheduled to ship that day and package merchandise to ensure safe transport
  • Inspect merchandise to ensure only quality product is used to complete the order
  • Accurately review counts of all incoming and outgoing shipments to verify information against invoices, orders or other records
  • Unpack, examine and route incoming shipments; record shortages and reject damaged items
  • Utilize pallet jacks, stand-up reach forklift and sit-down forklift where applicable

IDEAL CANDIDATE ATTRIBUTES:
  • 1+ year related warehouse experience

  • Forklift experience and RF scanner experience preferred
  • Ability to lift and move up to 60 pounds, safely, with or without accommodation
  • Ability to stand for long periods of time
  • Ability to work in a constant state of alertness and safe manner
WORKING CONDITIONS:
  • Work is conducted in a warehouse environment with temperature changes depending on the season
  • Working with or near conveyors depending on assignment

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance

Job Description

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:

Ensuring the security, tracking, and accountability of materials and goods required for inventory control (both controlled and non-controlled items). Responsibilities/tasks: Data input into the SAP computer system for receiving materials both controlled and non-controlled, quarantining materials; material transactions to/from manufacturing. The physical or administrative tasks involved in the receiving, storage and distribution of materials. Unpacks and checks condition and content of deliveries against purchase orders and packing slips; distributes materials to end users and other duties as assigned to support the Materials Department.

KEY DUTIES:

? Must be able to maintain adherence to established applicable SOPs for receiving and management of materials. Computer skills required for internal communications network and maintenance of database files.

? Ensuring all cGMP material receipts are handled in accordance with applicable FDA and cGMP procedures and properly segregated in the warehouse.

? Performing accurate Cycle Counts and investigations into errors that are found.

? Perform multiple transactions in SAP ? pull and stage materials supporting the manufacturing lines and departments throughout the company.

? Continuously rotate, move and manage materials to support and house required inventory levels.

? Assist in maintaining the high level of organization and cleanliness within the department to be inspection-ready at all times.

SKILLS/ABILITIES:

? Excellent analytical, verbal, written and interpersonal skills required.

? Must be extremely service and internal customer oriented.

? Must be able to effectively prioritize and manage multiple tasks.

? Must be a proactive problem solver.

? Knowledge of receipt and shipping procedures for hazardous materials.

? Knowledge of material receipt, quarantine, release, distribution and reconciliation procedures.

? Experience with material handling equipment: forklifts, hand truck and two wheel dolly.

? Requires strong math skills, with exceptional attention to detail.

? Ability to lift or move 40 lbs. overhead.

? Working knowledge of cGMPs, OSHA, EPA, and FDA regulations that pertain to warehousing.

? Have a valid driver?s license and be familiar with roads and highways in the area.

? Have basic computer skills.

? Have good math skills.

? Have good communication skills, both oral and written.

? Have good organizational skills and be able to work on your own.

? Punctual and dependable a must.

? Attention to detail; especially as related to documentation and materials CGMP.

? Positive attitude and excellent work ethic and a team player.

? Understands company objectives.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

? Minimum of two (2) years direct SAP experience in receipt and management of materials operations, preferably in a cGMP environment.

? Associates degree or BA/BS considered a plus,

? Must be familiar with DOT and cGMP requirements and documentation.

?

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

? Minimum of two (2) years direct SAP experience in receipt and management of materials operations, preferably in a cGMP environment.

? Associates degree or BA/BS considered a plus,

? Must be familiar with DOT and cGMP requirements and documentation.

Description
Employees are responsible for manual loading and unloading of freight with the use of a pallet jack or forklift in addition to general labor and general warehouse maintenance. Responsible for filling customer orders and delivering them to the delivery platform in a manner that meets company standards for safety, security, and productivity.Summary of Key Responsibilities:
Moves materials and items from receiving or production areas to storage or to other designated areas.
Receives, stores, and distributes material, tools, equipment, and products within assigned area.
May be trained in the use of heavy equipment such as forklift in preparation for certification as required to move to a Freight Handler role.
May sweep floors, clean dock area, general good hygiene of entire work area.
Assist in receiving cargo by removing from truck by hand, or using powered industrial equipment, such as forklift of similar equipment.
Assembles customer orders from stock and places orders on pallets or shelves, or moves order to packing station or shipping department.
Opens bales, crates, and other containers.
Sorts and places materials or items on racks, shelves, or in bins according to predetermined sequence such as size, type, style, color, or product code.Qualifications
Qualifications, Education, Knowledge, Experience & Skills:
High school diploma or GED required.
One to three years or experience in a warehouse environment.
Ability to frequently lift and/or move up to 50 lbs. and the ability to climb ladders required.
Ability to occasionally push/pull up to 100 lbs. required.
Must have good or corrected vision and the ability to add and subtract.
Basic language skills required.
Must be able to read, write, and speak English preferred.
Read, comprehend and complete basic checklists, forms, or related documents.
Must be able to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner and balances team and individual responsibilities.
Must have ability to consistently report to work and on time.
Prefer candidates to be forklift certified or have a few months experience on a forklift. May consider candidates without this experience if some exposure to operation other/similar equipment.

Job Description

JOB DESCRIPTION

TITLE: WAFER FAB OPERATOR

FLSA STATUS: NON-EXEMPT

SHIFTS:

A1: MONDAY THRU WEDNESDAY AND E/O THURSDAY FROM 5:30 AM TO 5:30 PM

A2: MONDAY THRU WEDNESDAY AND E/O THURSDAY FROM 6:00 AM TO 6:00 PM

B1: MONDAY THRU WEDNESDAY AND E/O THURSDAY FROM 5:30 PM TO 5:30 AM

B2: MONDAY THRU WEDNESDAY AND E/O THURSDAY FROM 6:00 PM TO 6:00 AM

C1: FRIDAY THRU SUNDAY AND E/O THURSDAY FROM 5:30 AM TO 5:30 PM

C2: FRIDAY THRU SUNDAY AND E/O THURSDAY FROM 6:00 AM TO 6:00 PM

D1: FRIDAY THRU SUNDAY AND E/O THURSDAY FROM 5:30 PM TO 5:30 AM

D2: FRIDAY THRU SUNDAY AND E/0 THURSDAY FROM 6:00 PM TO 6:00 AM

REPORTS TO: PRODUCTION SUPERVISOR

SUMMARY:

Under the direction of the Production Supervisor, the Wafer Fab Operator is responsible for dispositioning wafers through the various steps of the semiconductor wafer manufacturing production process, including the photolithography, plating, polish, and vacuum areas. The Wafer Fab Operator is also responsible for recording data in the Work in Process (WIP) tracking system, analyzing data and reporting anomalies, and learning, understanding, and adhering to established Manufacturing Engineering Instructions (MPI's); learning and achieving certification on various assigned tools or operations; and supporting continuous improvement activities for productivity, yield enhancement, and scrap reduction. This position is located in Milpitas, California.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
  • Dispositions wafers through the semiconductor wafer manufacturing production process, including the photolithography, plating, polish, and vacuum areas
  • Records data in the WIP tracking system
  • Analyzes data and reports anomalies to Production Supervisor if needed
  • Learns, understands, and adheres to established MPI's for assigned area
  • Learns, achieves, and maintains required certifications on assigned tools or operational area
  • Supports continuous improvement initiatives in the areas of productivity, yield enhancement, and scrap reduction
  • Responds to inquiries from other team members, managers, or departments
  • Adheres to all safety policies and procedures as required
  • Must be able to walk for long periods of time pushing a cart between clean aisles as required
  • Must be able to work overtime as required
  • *Performs other duties of a similar nature or level
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
  • One year of experience working as an Operator or Assembler in a high-volume manufacturing environment preferably in the semiconductor or electronics industry
  • Strong experience using microscopes, small hand tools, or manufacturing tools/equipment
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Applications
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
  • Knowledge of semiconductor or high-volume manufacturing processes, practices, and techniques
  • Knowledge and ability to use various types of microscopes, small hand tools, and/or manufacturing equipment
  • Knowledge and ability to use Microsoft Office applications to create spreadsheets and Word documents
  • Able to enter various types of data into a tracking application on a routine basis
  • Able to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with all levels of employees and management
  • Able to understand and follow complex directions whether given verbally or in writing
  • Able to comply with all safety policies and procedures
  • Able to walk for long periods of time pushing a cart between clean aisles
  • Demonstrated organizational and time management skills
  • Demonstrated problem-solving and trouble shooting skills
  • Flexible and able to prioritize
  • Detail oriented and conscientious
WORKING CONDITIONS:

The Wafer Fab Operator works in a class 100 ESD sensitive wafer manufacturing facility on an assigned shift; wears a cleanroom (bunny) suit, including hood, gloves, safety glasses, booties, and mask. May be exposed to hazardous conditions, chemicals, fumes, and/or gases during the course of work day; may be exposed to loud noise. Schedule may be altered from time-to-time to suit operational needs. Stands and walks; performs various fine grasping movements, bends, and twists; operates a computer and enters information using a keyboard, operates a telephone, and other office equipment. May be required to sit, stand, or walk for long periods of time, closely observe items through a microscope, and perform repetitive grasping motions; uses a variety of small hand tools to perform various operations. May be exposed to high-volume noise and/or hazardous materials such as chemicals or particulate matter. May occasionally be required to push, pull, or lift up to 30 pounds. Must be able to work overtime when required.

*Other duties of a similar nature or level are duties that may be required, but may not be specifically listed in the job description or posting.

TDK/Headway Technologies, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. Applicants requiring accommodation in order to complete the application process should contact the Headway Human Resources Department.

About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nation’s leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.

Position Summary:

Under the supervision of the Director, will organize a comprehensive volunteer program to include high school, college students and adults. Coordinator will recruit, train and supervise volunteers and establish relationships to encourage engagement and retention of volunteers. Act as liaison between volunteers and medical center, staff and community. This position may provide program coordination for Volunteer Services Programs: Art for the Heart, Hope Volunteer Visitor Program, Hope Transplant Program and the Student Resource Advocates Program and the Advance Care Planning Program.

Key Responsibilities include:

  • Recruits, trains, and supervises volunteers for the high school, college students and adult populations and provides placements by assessing volunteer skills and institutional needs in conjunction with Volunteer Services staff.
  • Represents the division and City of Hope with internal and external contacts; identifies opportunities to partner with various departments to develop and implement a broader range of opportunities for volunteers to provide extraordinary care to patients and families.
  • In conjunctions with Advance Care Planning staff, this position may assist with coordinating events and materials for National Healthcare Decision week and other Advance Care Planning events and meetings and recruiting, training and supervising volunteers for events.
  • Serves in conjunction with the Director in coordinating specialized Volunteer Services trainings and programs; provides administrative assistance as needed.
  • Develops and implements new systems for tracking uniforms, expenditures and required paperwork. Oversees and maintains division reports and records; collects statistical data for administrative and regulatory purposes.
  • Independently manages division contracts/requisitions; solicits information from outside vendors and plans; contacts hotel to request contracts; arranges for entertainment; implements Volunteer Recognition and Holiday events in conjunction with Volunteer Services staff.
  • Processes all paperwork for on-boarding of volunteers, coordinates schedule and placement and maintains /audits volunteer records for compliancy
  • Participates in DSCM work teams to identify areas of opportunity to build programs/resources to better serve patients and families.
  • Actively identify how to utilize volunteer tracking software to generate schedules, hours and location reports to evaluate trends and problem areas to provide a more efficient and effective program
  • Represents Volunteer Services to community and professional groups.
  • Oversees office volunteers who perform inventories of uniforms, service pins and other supplies and prepare packets and mailings for upcoming orientations/training.
  • Provides administrative support to Director for Volunteer Services and Advance Care Planning Programs.

Basic education, experience and skills required for consideration:

  • High School Diploma
  • Three (3) years of experience in administrative capacity or supervision
  • Experience with volunteers preferred.
Required Certification/Licensure:
  • Active membership in a professional volunteer organization, may be obtained post-employment.

City of Hope is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

AC2019

Overview

Job Summary

The Vitamin Department Manager is responsible for the successful operation and profitability of the vitamin department as well as training, directing and monitoring all department staff. Department Managers are responsible for the success of their own department and are required to fulfill the duties of the Manager on Duty (MOD) on a scheduled basis.

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities include the following essential functions, but are not limited to:

  • Providing World Class Customer Service as a number one priority.
  • Exemplifying integrity, responsibility, and excellence and adhering to all policies.
  • Creating an inviting, full and shopable department.
  • Ordering for the vitamin department and maintaining accurate inventory levels.
  • Managing margin, COGs and overall department profitability including minimizing shrink and maximizing effective purchasing.
  • Ensuring all in-stock products/conditions meet company standards.
  • Offering and following up on special orders.
  • Merchandising shelves, endcaps and dynamic displays.
  • Managing and participating in tagging, facing, rotating, cleaning, markdowns, stocking, and backstock.
  • Training and monitoring department personnel including assigning and following up on tasks.
  • Working with other department managers to cross-train staff to accomplish all needed tasks.
  • Conducting active and passive demos.
  • Supervising the Nutritional Health Coach (NHC) when the NHC is performing vitamin aisle duties.
  • Assisting in interviewing and hiring for department needs.
  • Working with the store manager to address performance and/or disciplinary issues within the department.
  • Opening and closing of store, including DSR and the closing cash process.
  • Handling register functions including backup cashiering, managing customer returns, addressing customer complaints, and covering register shift changes, including those for scheduled breaks.
  • Maintaining the safety and security of customers and employees.
  • Answering customer questions per company standards and policies, including the use of Structure/Function statements and/or statements of nutritional support.
  • Continually increasing product knowledge.
  • Using SAP and inventory management software, running and analyzing reports on BEx, emailing and utilizing other IS programs as needed.
  • Working a schedule based on store needs which includes evenings, weekends, holidays. Position requires working five days, 40 hours per week and attending mandatory store meetings.

Although this is a general outline of job responsibilities all employees are expected to be ''hands on'' and do whatever it takes to get the job done and make the company thrive.

Qualifications

Education, Skills & Experience

  • High School diploma, GED or equivalent preferred.
  • 1-2 years of experience in retail experience in a grocery or retail environment; natural foods background is a plus.
  • 1-2 years of experience supervising others preferred.
  • 1-2 years of experience in vitamins/supplements preferred.
  • Ability to pass food safety training courses and/or certifications as required by law and maintain compliance by keeping certifications up to date and registered if applicable.
  • Ability to manage changing priorities and to stay focused with the task at hand.
  • Sense of urgency in the completion of tasks.
  • Excellent customer service skills.
  • Highly organized with great attention to detail.
  • Ability to take direction and follow through.
  • Must be cashier trained and able to count currency.
  • Proficient in MS Word, Excel and Outlook.

This job description is not an employment contract. It does not guarantee a job or that the above listed duties are the limit of responsibilities. The job and job description are subject to change with and without notice. Employees are required to accomplish any and all tasks as assigned by the Store Manager and/or other corporate managers that may not be listed in this job description.

Job Description

Medical care professionals, are you looking for an exciting and rewarding career opportunity to work with a leading provider of laser vision correction in the United States? Would you like to work for a second generation, family owned business that helps people see? Would you like to help donate money and glasses to underprivileged people in our country and beyond? Join US at Lasik Plus Due to our continued growth, we are looking for highly motivated Technicians to join our team. We have a training program and will train motivated and committed individuals who have a passion for patient care and customer service. In this position, you will play a key role assisting the ophthalmologist in all aspects of patient care. If you would like to join an environment that will inspire you to expect the most of yourself and your career, and if you meet our requirements, we definitely want to hear from you. Contact us today Job Responsibilities As a Vision Health Technician, you will be responsible for pre and post-operative care to patients by following standard operating procedures, and preparing patients for treatment and assisting ophthalmologist in LASIK surgery. Additional responsibilities for this retail ophthalmology role include: Delivering quality patient care, excellent communication and customer service Assisting ophthalmologist in surgery suite with LASIK procedure Applying drops to anesthetize, dilate, or medicate eyes Educating patients by providing information regarding treatment, use of drops and drugs Ensuring confidentiality by completing and safeguarding medical records Operating various ophthalmology diagnostic equipment Job Requirements As a Vision Health Technician, you should possess exceptional organizational and problem solving skills, with the ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a highly-dynamic work environment. Additionally, it is important that you display excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal and presentation skills, as well as the ability to communicate complex information to patients and family members. Specific qualifications for this health care role include: High School diploma or GED Prior experience in sales or retail role, preferred Basic office equipment and computer skills Ophthalmic/optometric experience, preferred but not required Join LasikPlus and help us transform the lives of our patients. Apply now Lasik Plus is an equal opportunity employer. To learn more about our company please visit us at or see our great reviews on Glassdoor.

AC2019

Job Description

Client Reference Code: 242751
Job Summary
The primary role comprises responsibilities in solution implementation, integration, validation and subject matter expertise in QAM based Advanced Advertising systems within Charter?s Corporate Lab environments. This video engineer will work with Cloud Video and Platform Architecture, Software Engineering, Product, Test Teams and Video Operations. Following lab build, integration and validation, sustained engineering and maintenance is required in order to support program level testing, as well as upgrades or issues found in production.
Deploy Lab systems based on the Next Generation Advertising Architectures for QAM and IP, Perform Integration and testing (Functional, Failover, Performance and Load, Regression and Bug Fix testing).

Major Duties and Responsibilites
This position will be responsible for deploying lab systems based on Advanced Advertising Architectures, perform integration and testing including functional validation, failover, performance and load, regression and bug fix testing. This includes deployment and certification testing for Video Encoders, Packagers, Manifest Manipulataors, Ad Routers, Next Generation Insertion systems and Ad Placement Opportunity Systems. The position will support multiple projects/systems of medium to high complexity, and provide program test support across organizations. Author and deliver implementation guides for video operations. Establish and maintain current state baseline certification and technology documentation throughout the technology lifecycle, including end-of-life transitions and migrations. Foster strategic relationships within Charter, and with vendor partners.

Required Qualifications
Deep knowledge of network service protocols including but not limited to DNS, HTTP, Media Streaming technologies, object caching, etc. Deep knowledge of distribution media delivery models (e.g. CDN), streaming media protocols (HLS, HD, RTSP), understanding of Cloud Based DVR architectures. Extensive experience of video encoding, transcoding, translate and decode. Extensive experience and understanding of Video on Demand, Electronic Program Guides, Metadata Management. Knowledge of distributed cloud and storage architectures (e.g. VMware, OpenStack). Understanding media container formats including but not limited to 3GP, AVI, MPEG program streams, MPEG2-TS, MP4, FLV/F4V, Motion JPEG 2000, H.264/MPEG-4 AVC. Operator level experience with Linux with the ability to perform application configuration and administration. Experience with CLI, Unix Shells (bash, csh, other), shell scripting, various OS level daemon services including but not limited to SMTP, SNMP, NTP, DNS, crond, PAM, HTTPd, other. Experience with infrastructure hardware including bare metal compute and storage components. Understanding of IPv4 and IPv6 networking. Understanding of system engineering practice. Understand waterfall and agile product lifecycle development processes. Deep understanding of network analytics, capacity models and distribution performance statistics. Demonstrated ability to work end-to-end at various levels of abstraction, solution definition, solution certification, and operational deployment. Demonstrated success leading product developments, including substantial technology migration activities. Demonstrated ability to meet delivery dates for small, medium, and large scale development projects. Strong ability to analyze and interpret data. Proven technical writer.

Education
Bachelors Degree in Information Systems, Software Development, Systems Administration, Network Administration, Engineering or other related field.

Related Work Experience (Number of Years)
A combination skill set of Video Engineering, System, Network and Application administration is preferred. Candidate would ideally have worked in the Telco industry for 2 ? 5 years or more with exposure to Video based applications.

Working Conditions
Office Environment
Some travel required

Job Code : ENE309 Network Engineer II Exempt

AC2019

Job Description

Based in Louisville, Colorado and reporting to the President, the Vice President of Talent must be a transformational leader with extensive experience in aligning innovative human capital solutions with business strategy resulting in the long-term sustainable success of the organization. The VP of Talent will provide strategic leadership and direction of company?s human resources functions, processes, and practices that help drive growth and maximize achievement of short and long-term business goals. This is a powerful opportunity to scale the company to the next level with talent management as a strategic focus, while preserving the positive and unique elements of the existing culture.

The VP will serve as a member of the senior leadership team and will develop and execute strategies to support a capable, engaged, and energetic employee community. Key areas of responsibility include organizational strategy and design, leadership and employee development, change management, performance management, employee relations, talent acquisition, employee engagement, organizational culture, total rewards and recognition, employee communications, HR compliance, organizational development and effectiveness, and HRIS.?

This role will oversee all HR activities for Company, anticipate and drive any human resources related changes necessary for the health of the organization, and act as a trusted advisor to the President and the senior leadership team.?

Love of cycling, passion for quality, respect, and a desire to make a difference are key traits the ideal candidate should possess. Moreover, the VP must be a keenly motivated problem-solver and self-starter who exhibits personal courage, composure, outstanding judgment, and a deep connection to the employee population. Company seeks a Vice President of Talent who will feel at home in a fast-paced, productive, dynamic, and collaborative environment that is dedicated to unlocking the power of inspiration and impact.

Essential Responsibilities

Organizational Leadership/Business Partner:
? Participate in planning the strategic direction of the business and in developing long-range plans to achieve objectives.
? Partner with functional leaders to ensure that organizational structure, design, and staffing are consistent with business needs and support realization of the Vision and business strategies.
? Partner with functional VPs to integrate human resources support.
? Provide leadership and guidance on organizational change management.
? Employee Engagement/ Organization Effectiveness/ Development:
? Evaluate company culture and provide recommendations on changes to accomplish company goals and objectives while maintaining cultural ethos.
? Develop strategies and tactics to ensure engagement and alignment of employees.

HR Functional Leadership:
? Develop and set functional direction and goals for HR team in alignment with the company?s business objectives.
? Attract, hire and/or develop talent and leadership capability within the HR team, and support for broader organization.
? Act as an internal consultant for management and employees to anticipate, identify and facilitate resolution of employee relations issues consistent with policies/practices, legal considerations, and company priorities.
? Identify legal requirements and government reporting regulations affecting HR function (e.g., OSHA, EEO, ERISA, Wage & Hour). Monitor exposure of the company and direct the preparation of information required for compliance.
? Oversee implementation of programs through human resources staff. Monitor administration to standards. Identify opportunities and resolve discrepancies.
? Develop and manage annual budgets for the HR organization.

Employee Communications:
? Partner with relevant departments to lead all aspects of internal communications.
? Develop a communications strategy to ensure that employees are informed, aligned, and engaged with key business priorities.

Performance and Total Rewards Management:

Training and Development:
? Develop strategies to address leadership and employee development needs.
? Design and implement organizational development programs to ensure long term succession plans are implemented and sustainable.

Professional & Cultural Characteristics

Living the Values
? As noted above, our core values are Trust, Craft, Empathy, Impact, and Plus 1.
? The successful candidate must demonstrate commitment to these values.

Effective Collaborator & Influencer
? Highly collaborative, low ego approach in working with colleagues leveraging high levels of emotional intelligence ? self-awareness, self-management, and relationship management ? to achieve positive results.

Strong Strategic & Results Orientation

Exceptional Team Leadership & Organizational Effectiveness
? Experience leading teams with the technical, operational, and business skills needed to deliver on business mandates.
? Track record of building and mentoring a team to achieve and improve levels of performance; must be able to describe examples of having not only attracted, retained, coached, and developed individuals, but also having taken appropriate and timely decisions to improve the effectiveness of the overall team.

? Unquestioned integrity to effectively address sensitive HR issues.

Qualifications

? Minimum ten years in a senior human resources management position with at least five years in a leadership role.

Job Description

Company is disrupting luxury fashion retailing by giving shoppers direct access to designers and their collections, as soon as they hit the runways. With $300M raised from top investors and a strong traction worldwide, Company is uniquely positioned to serve high-end fashion customers for all their wardrobe needs, through a unique combination of digital e-commerce channels, private showrooms and personal stylists.?

The Vice President Supply Chain serves as the senior Supply Chain leader for Company, reporting directly to the SVP, Operations. They are responsible for the management and optimization of all supply chain activities including, operations, distribution, customer experience, delivery? and logistics. This strategic leader will guide Company?s supply chain vision, planning, and execution.? They will work closely with other senior leaders, customers, and supplier partners to enhance profitability, create optimal inventory strategies, generate greater productivity, and drive efficiencies across the network.

What You'll Do?
  • Be a true strategic business partner and thought leader for the SVP, Operations and Company senior leadership team and Board
  • Design and develop new and innovative methodologies, processes, and relationships to provide outsourced procurement, sourcing, and manufacturing to emerging designers on the Company platform.
  • Responsible to oversee the supply chain function from purchase order to delivery, including inventory planning, order fulfillment, shipping, delivery, value added services and receiving
  • As a member of the senior leadership team, they will participate in setting the strategic and operational direction of the company
  • Lead a large team ensuring appropriate functional expertise, establish a vision, and transition easily between strategy and the daily tactics of the business
  • Develop inventory strategies to maintain optimal inventory levels to meet desired customer fill rates, achieve inventory turn goals, and avoid supply disruption
  • Accountable for integration of supply chain activities across the organization enabling optimal customer service, product supply, and inventory investment
  • Build and manage strategic external partnerships with customers, suppliers, and other strategic entities
  • Responsible for the China & Hong Kong Operations, overseeing an International team of Quality, Sourcing, Delivery, Logistics, Engineering, and Administration
  • Actively collaborate with key strategic suppliers to ensure two-way, collaborative relationships that deliver an operational competitive advantage
  • Able to anticipate and implement necessary changes to supply chain strategy and process to support growth and commitments to customers
  • Develop and support margin improvement initiatives by developing strategies to address supply chain risk while delivering hard savings
  • Drive and enable culture of continuous improvement
  • Provide dynamic leadership to build, develop, manage, and evaluate high performing teams
  • Responsible for management of multiple sites to drive common solutions and standardization
Who You Are:
  • Bachelor?s degree, MBA preferred
  • 12-years progressive experience managing and directing a supply chain organization with multiple sites; minimum 5-years in a senior leadership role
  • Proven record of accomplishment in supply chain with demonstrated ability to articulate a future vision, business plan and profitability while meeting and/or exceeding corporate goals
  • Ability to translate and communicate a strategic plan into tactical goals
  • Ability to build cross-functional partnerships and engage in and lead cross-functional teams and initiatives
  • Possess personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and commitment to the organizational values
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively inspire, develop, and lead a team
  • Exceptional executive presence, communication, organizational and interpersonal skills, with strong ability to make decisions and collaborate across the business
Leadership Skills
  • Ability to quickly assess an operational situation and deploy resources to resolve
  • Excellent written/verbal/presentation skills
  • Ability to motivate and inspire
  • Collaborative problem solver
  • Driver & Doer mentality; goes above and beyond in solving issues
  • Open to change, driver of change
  • Digs into details of the business; empowers managers to execute
  • Champions consistent business approaches and measurement across sites
  • Learner / Growth Mindset: Demonstrated recent examples where they invested time into personal continuous improvement
  • Planner / Implementor: Strong Penchant for Planning and executing to KPIs
  • Displays balance of confidence with authenticity/emotional intelligence/team player
  • Good educational background (University or better) + APICS / Six Sigma preferred
  • Strong emphasis in Supply Chain Management is preferred over distribution or customer service (ideally the candidate has experience in all 3 areas)
  • Slightly fast paced & direct communication style
