Job Description

Company is an emerging, dynamic brand consisting of a team of passionate individuals who believe whole food based nutrition is essential for overall health, fitness and wellbeing. Our team, where job titles and hierarchy are meaningless, is comprised of intelligent and innovative talent who work collaboratively to ensure creativity, success, and global growth. Company seeks to develop and support the right people, with the right chemistry, who continually ask questions, and in turn will develop and tactically execute good ideas. We are looking for individuals to help us think smarter and put a lot of ideas on the table in a short amount of time. Building a great company is our goal. Quality individuals and getting the team right is our business plan.
Role:
The Vice President?of Supply Chain will be integral in supporting the?scaling growth of Company'?products, innovations, and customer reach.? This role will be responsible for working with senior leadership to support and provide strategic direction across the organization, encompassing all?functions of supply chain.? You will also be tasked with building and leading a world-class supply team at all levels of the organization.? This role will report directly to the CEO and work out of our West Loop headquarters, with frequent travel to our Franklin Park facility and vendor locations as needed.?
What you will be responsible for:
  • Develop a supply chain strategy that supports and aligns with overall corporate strategic direction, company financial objectives and customer expectations.
  • Update senior management on core supply chain performance, including product and service level agreements and cost objectives.
  • Develop capabilities and initiatives to support supply chain performance over a multi-year horizon
  • Manage a comprehensive supplier bid process from defining the scope, through negotiation and execution, to awarding the contracts.
  • Review and evaluate supply chain and streamline processes and relationships.
  • Evaluate, set up and manage negotiations, contracts and agreements with all third party partners (manufacturing, vendors, etc.)
  • Responsible for the direction and coordination of purchasing activities.
  • Continually challenge the status quo, seeking new initiatives to keep pace with and leverage opportunities presented by Company growth
  • Maintain routines to ensure delivery of core supply chain metrics in terms of cost and service.
  • Prepare and present market analysis reports to top management
  • Continually monitor production capacity, planned output and inventory status, and identify and address current or anticipated shortages and overages
  • Coordinate schedules and resolve issues among suppliers and plants to ensure material availability necessary to support on-time shipments
  • Provide logistical and warehousing support to Third Party Manufacturers and manage third party logistics operations in the warehousing and order fulfillment of customer demand.
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable federal requirements, quality, safety guidelines and standards.
  • Program, manage and participate in the creation, distribution, presentation and/or approval of the company's S&OP process inputs / outputs (e.g., pricing/promo plans, demand forecasts, supply plans, inventory plans, financial plans, etc.) and key metrics (e.g., forecast accuracy, inventory days-on-hand, retail in-stocks, device subsidy, etc.)
  • Manage conflicting strategic priorities and multiple opportunities to find the best way of creating long-term success
Who you are:
  • Bachelors Degree in Supply Chain/Logistics, Business Finance, Industrial?Engineering or related discipline.
  • 15 + years Food or Beverage industry experience
  • 8 + years of experience in a leadership role, growing and developing a team
  • Strong professional knowledge in all aspects of supply chain (planning, transportation, warehousing, order processing and customer collaboration)
  • Demonstrated success at influencing without authority in supply chain setup and transformation efforts
  • Previous experience?in NetSuite or related supply planning systems preferred
  • Conceptual thinker who can move from strategy to tactical implementation seamlessly.
  • Skilled in negotiating and proven record of business acumen?
  • Strong management skills in dealing with internal and external customers
  • Ability to sell and convey new business ideas and concepts
  • Attention to detail with a strategic ?big picture? mindset
  • Good spoken and written communication skills and comfortable interacting with all levels of the organization
  • Good problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and quickly changing priorities?
  • Experience with startups highly desired

Job Description

Your role:

You?ll establish the global strategy and guidance for the Supply Chain organization including Supplier Management, Strategic Planning, Component and Assembly Sourcing, Warehousing, and Distribution activities.? You?ll provide direction to all activities related to the timely, efficient, cost-effective procurement, inventory management, planning and distribution of production materials for all company products. ?You?ll develops the strategy for implementing and maintaining policies, procedures, material control systems to reduce costs, and lean initiatives that support cost effective solutions while ensuring SOX compliance.? You?ll develop strategies and critical business relationships with supplier partners to support outsourcing activities and establish required processes to support new product introductions.

What you?ll be doing: ?
  • Work closely with Quality and Manufacturing Engineering to support the process of developing and qualifying suppliers, and disqualification of suppliers as required
  • Develop the processes for establishing and managing supplier relationships
  • Work with Legal to implement contracts (Material Supplier Agreements) for all suppliers to mitigate risk to business operations
  • Lead contract negotiations to ensure long term cost reduction and strategic partnerships with suppliers
  • Work with Engineering in identifying new supply sources and evaluating vendor reliability
  • Direct the company demand planning process, including strategic demand planning initiatives, Master Production Schedules, and Material requirements planning process. Leads the Operation?s team in support of the Sales, Inventory, and Operations Planning process
  • Responsible for all purchasing controls and ensures compliance to all regulatory requirements, including FDA, ISO 13485, SEC requirements (conflict minerals), and Sarbanes Oxley controls
  • Manage the organization responsible for the purchasing process, including obtaining quotations and placing purchase orders from qualified suppliers for goods and services utilized in the manufacturing of medical products
  • Manage the organization responsible for demand planning across all product families and develops short term supply mitigation solutions in response to sudden demand changes or product quality issues
  • Manage the organization responsible for MRO buying (Maintenance, Repair, and Operating supplies)
  • Organizational responsibilities for establishing International business processes such as planning and distribution, including relationship with International Distributors.
  • Manage the organization responsible for material inventory and distribution including the processes for Inventory Management Reporting, including ADOH (average days on hand) and develops applicable metrics for evaluation and control of purchased material.
  • Manage the organization responsible for the infusion set products including procurement, inventory control, distribution and business relationship.
  • Work with Manufacturing Engineering and Quality to develop and implement component and supplier cost reduction strategies to achieve business results by lowering overall product costs
  • Provide support for new product introductions into manufacturing
  • Ensure department?s adherence to company policies, including Privacy/HIPAA, as well as other legal and regulatory directives.
  • Direct long and short-term planning for the department including headcount, budgeting, training, and systems requirements.
  • Participate in the selection, development, performance appraisal, merit recommendation, and promotion of department staff.
  • Support the development, communication, and evaluation of goals for the group based on company goals on an annual basis.
  • Other duties as assigned.
What you need for this position: ?
  • Strong knowledge and application of principles outlined in Quality System Regulations (QSRs/GMPs).
  • Extensive knowledge of ERP systems for planning, scheduling, purchasing and inventory
  • Proven ability to drive quality and productivity improvements.
  • Excellent skills in cGMP documentation, policies and procedures, protocols, work instructions, inspection requirements, etc.
  • Skilled at effectively communicating department or area issues and results within and across functional areas and conducting presentations of technical information concerning specific projects or timelines. Able to gain cooperation of others.
  • Skilled at effectively leading a cooperative team effort and organizing resources to achieve team goals. Able to make and prioritize process and resource decisions based on overall team needs.
  • Ability to provide annual organizational budget requirements such as resources and materials
Minimum certifications/educational level:
  • BA/BS or equivalent combination of education and applicable job experience.
  • APICS certification preferred.
Minimum experience:
  • 15 years experience in supply chain management within a $500M medical device market.
  • Experience in planning, scheduling, and monitoring the movement of materials through the production cycle and in providing procurement support to new product programs.
  • cGMP experience.

Widely recognized as a thought leader and effective business driver. Portfolio Director, VP San Francisco Corporate Offices At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You'll always feel empowered and valued here. The portfolio director is a senior business leader responsible for overseeing and managing the full change portfolio (Programs, Products, Projects, including department level projects) across a number of business units that are grouped together as a cross-functional portfolio. The Portfolio Director role exists to improve the management and delivery of new capabilities, experiences and features for the bank, its clients and employees. The Portfolio Director contributes transformation of the company toward an Agile and productized delivery model. What you'll do as a Portfolio Director: * Work with business leaders and product managers in respective business units in a facilitative function to ensure that portfolio investments are tied to strategic objectives and outcomes have been defined by the respective business and product leads * Understand delivery status, interdependency mapping and resource planning of the portfolio to optimize timing, sequencing, and resolve bottlenecks * Act in a "program manager" execution role for at least one project / year * Facilitating the presentment of annual portfolios plan and quarterly updates, in collaboration with the relevant department leads and in accordance with the annual planning process * Cover the full change scope for a given portfolio, including cross-enterprise programs, projects, products, and department level projects with a focus on Corporate Services: Accounting, Finance, Vendor Management, HR, Legal and Compliance * Collaborate to drive Agile transformation toward a productized delivery model * Work cross-functionally with other Portfolio Directors, product managers, business technology partners and program managers to stay apprised of initiative progress and upcoming risks and interdependencies through quarterly forums and as-needed discussions; work to resolve any dependencies with peer group * Ensure that the full portfolio adheres to Enterprise Portfolio Management standards Key outcomes a Portfolio Director is expected to accomplish include: * A shared portfolio of projects, products, and programs that is tied to the strategic objectives of the respective business units and the bank * An articulation of clear business outcomes to be delivered by the portfolio, over the near, medium and long term horizons (outcomes are measurable and observable benefits to the banks clients, bankers, bank functions, etc.) * More efficient delivery across the bank by resolving dependencies and optimizing investments with close collaborating with other Portfolio Directors, identifying leverage opportunities where possible * Construct an annual portfolio of change to input into the bank's annual planning process * Champion progressive adoption of Agile delivery methods and productized view of the portfolio * Ongoing (about quarterly) reviews of the portfolio for executive leadership to assess performance against delivering business outcomes What skills you will use: * Senior management related leaderships skills * Experience executing enterprise-level projects and/or product management * Superior communication skills * Experience with enterprise products and projects within Accounting, Finance, HR, Compliance, and Legal functions * Track record of success working in a fast-paced growth company delivering projects and products Own your work and your career — apply now Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us. We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability — that's the First Republic way. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, to the extent consistent with applicable federal and/or state law. Job Description

We are a fast growing startup committed to building a team with uncommon talent. This requires a leader with experience to lead investment in our talent, culture, and capabilities to fuel the growth of our business. You will partner with all areas of the company to help our team build and support their organizations. This will involve driving recruitment of the best talent, coaching on team leadership, helping to resolving employee relations issues and managing programs that help develop staff. This position is a key strategic role in the company helping to grow the business and allowing us to build a unique and strong people oriented culture at Company.
We care a lot about our people and culture, and we're looking for someone who shares our passion for building strong companies from within. This position is based in Redwood City, working alongside our management team, and will report to the CEO.
Responsibilities:
  • Utilize knowledge of business needs and priorities to develop recruiting strategies and programs that ensure an ongoing pipeline of top talent to fill positions at all levels in the organization including strategic and executive positions
  • Provide expert guidance, facilitation and collaboration for all senior leaders and hiring leaders to recruit, identify, select, onboard, and retain highly skilled best in class candidates

  • Provide leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to the Talent Acquisition team and hiring leaders on interviewing best practices, offer recommendations, negotiating/creating job offers, closing, and administrative functions involved in full cycle recruiting

  • Provide human resources support and consultation across the business on the most complex issues, supporting staff, managers and executives in all related areas and regions including: recruitment, performance management, compensation and rewards, staff relations, and people development
  • Provide useful data to help guide decision making, and allow the company to scale effectively and efficiently. Provide leadership on people related issues and policies across the company
  • Be able to communicate at all levels in the company and to support business development and change
  • Design, implement and maintain the appropriate processes, tools, systems and training necessary to scale and support the recruiting function
  • Create a strategic plan for and organizational model that provides a unique menu of talent services designed to operate at a scale and efficiency for the business and talent acquisition function
  • Build talent communities and talent pipelines for critical skill areas and diversity sourcing efforts, that yield into hiring outcomes for the business
  • Manage efficient, fast-paced full-cycle recruiting operations that support Company?s rapid growth plans
  • Develop and implement employer branding efforts and strategy for Company
Requirements:
  • 10+ years of broad recruiting and leadership experience in Talent Acquisition or People Operations role
  • Experience in leading a People Operations, Recruiting or Human Resources team
  • A successful track-record of talent acquisition management at a rapidly growing technology company
  • Demonstrated experience creating and executing a metrics-driven, consultative service oriented recruiting strategy for a growing organization
  • Ability to develop business cases and service requirements, influence and foster trust with stakeholders at all levels, while creating and managing strategic alliances
  • Deep expertise in digital marketing and recruiting platforms/tools, and employer brand best practices
  • Strong interpersonal savvy and self-awareness with strong written and verbal communication skills

Who Are We

Innovation is at the heart of everything we do at Company. While working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, you are given the opportunity to collaborate with co-workers to make every customers interaction with Company a great one.
What Are We Looking For
Company is seeking a Vice President of People to join our growing team! A successful candidate will have experience managing Human Resources and recruitment, be hard working, technically savvy and thrive in a growing, fast-paced environment.
Position Responsibilities-
  • HR Partner The Vice President of People will serve as true strategic HR partner to Company leadership team

    • S/he will work closely with management to develop corporate recruiting strategies to identify top talent

    • S/he will possess strong ability to screen, interview and prepare an ideal candidate slate within an appropriate and consistent timeline
  • Special Projects ??The Vice President will manage special projects relating to training, employee services, organizational development, and vendor management
?What is Important to Us

AC2019

At Nautilus, fitness isn’t just a job, it’s our passion. We strive to improve the health and well-being of everyone who works with us because we see the benefits of a happier, more productive, engaged and creative workforce. Our culture is one that promotes work life balance; offers continuing education on topics ranging from improving workplace skills to better financial security; and promotes the importance of getting involved and giving back to the community.

We're a leading marketer and developer of health and fitness products with some of the most recognized brands in the industry, including Nautilus®, Bowflex®, Octane Fitness®, Schwinn® Fitness and Universal®. We are currently recruiting for a Vice President, Operations to join our Global Operations team at our headquarters in Vancouver, WA.

SUMMARY

Our future Vice President of Operations will play a highly visible, critical role on the Nautilus’ Senior Leadership Team. The ideal candidate will have been responsible for Global Sourcing, Inventory Planning and Management, Purchasing, Quality Management, Distribution and Logistics for a hard-goods consumer products company with products sourced internationally.

The Vice President of Operations will, plan, implement, and manage Nautilus’ global distribution, logistics and sourcing strategy. This individual will lead a team in the United States and Asia and will work cross functionally with the SVP’s and General Managers of the company, as well as Product Line Management, Sales and Marketing.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Manage sourcing processes and procedures to successfully execute and deliver products on time and on budget, which meet the design, quality and value mission for Nautilus
  • Lead the distribution team to execute the customer order/fulfillment process with industry leading levels of service, both internal teams and Third-Party Logistics partners
  • Manage Corporate Quality both domestically and internationally
  • Develop teams to lead ongoing continuous improvement and drive KPIs to track progress on lead times, logistics costs, delivery performance, asset utilization and inventory risk
  • Lead the Inbound and Outbound Logistics functions
  • Responsible for the China Operations, indirectly overseeing a team of over 20 employees supporting Purchasing, Quality, Sourcing, Engineering, and Administration
  • Orchestrate and monitor improvements across the supply chain to enable achievement of consumer business objectives
  • Responsible for data analysis to create and monitor processes
  • Ensure all Import/Export documentation is maintained and all processes meet regulatory requirements
  • Responsible for coordination with Sales, Accounts Payable, Fixed Assets, Outside Sources (i.e. vendors, freight carriers), Procurement and Field Operations
  • Ensures all DC facilities and equipment are properly maintained, safe and secure
  • Support the needs of the supply chain planner/buyers in maintaining targeted inventory levels and inventory turns
  • Evaluate and continually improve all internal and external distribution channels
  • Continually monitor the effectiveness of all transportation agreements for performance; work with suppliers to optimize performance, costs, and partnerships
  • Provide direct leadership to Nautilus’ Sales, Inventory and Operations Planning (SIOP), Distribution, Logistics, and Fulfillment teams to ensure accurate demand/supply planning and the efficient and cost-effective transport, warehousing and ultimate fulfillment of all inventory
  • Ensure adherence to all customs/trade compliance standards, rules and regulations
  • Help drive decisions on new/enhanced tools, platforms and programs for efficient, sustainable processes and growth
  • Align business and operational objectives with positive relationships across the enterprise to ensure informed inventory decisions, best-in-class service, support digital acceleration, and on-time delivery. Make decisions and hard trade-offs with leaders across the globe to ensure Nautilus meets or exceeds its customers’ expectations while ensuring profitable growth
  • As a member of the leadership team, ensure Nautilus’ core values and business objectives are respected and delivered across the enterprise
  • Attract, develop and retain strong, diverse talent by engaging in culture curation, succession planning, associate and manager development and being a champion of employee engagement
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

Provides leadership to the Operations team, including the development of the team. Responsibilities include recruiting and retaining staff as well as conducting regular goal/performance reviews. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in business and a minimum of fifteen years of experience leading global business operations in a leadership position responsible for both strategic direction and tactical execution of demand/supply planning and supply chain logistics/fulfillment functions; recent experience in an executive management or Vice President of Operations role, managing global sourcing, distribution and logistics for a manufacturing, retail or wholesale company with minimum annual sales of $200 million. Master’s of Business Administration (MBA) degree preferred
  • Well-developed knowledge of international sourcing strategies and trends by product categories and regions
  • Experience working with OEM suppliers and manufacturers
  • Extensive knowledge of ERP/Supply Chain Management systems
  • Strong leadership skills and the ability to manage organizational change
  • Knowledge of world class manufacturing, Lean principles and quality systems
  • Must be able to travel internationally at least 25% percent of the time, specifically in China and Taiwan
  • Excellent business, operational, analytical and strategic planning skills with demonstrated strong attention to working in a highly collaborative culture
  • Demonstrated experience championing and leading continuous improvement efforts across disciplines. Embrace and demonstrate innovation and initiative—always looking to improve operations, products, services and processes with the customer in the center
  • Willingness to dive into the details, get hands dirty, and work towards agreed-upon results, but tempered with an ability to envision the bigger picture and long-term goals
  • Proven ability to lead through influence in objective setting, problem solving and decision-making in a team oriented, dynamic and complex global environment
  • Strong presentation and interpersonal communication skills that inspire, motivate and build trust, and which result in effective working relationships with colleagues and outside business partners
  • A leadership track record including leading organizations, building teams, developing staff and enabling business and functional growth
  • Proven ability to attract, retain and develop leaders and associates with a long-term vision for developing capabilities and succession planning to ensure sustainable business success
We offer a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, 401(k) match, ESPP, life & accident insurance, disability insurance, paid vacation and holidays, wellness program, tuition reimbursement, product discounts and free use of our employee fitness center for yourself and spouse.

Nautilus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to diversity in its workforce. In demonstration of our commitment to a healthier lifestyle, we are proud to be a smoke-free campus.

Job Description

Make your mark in Broadcasting and Digital Media. Sinclair Broadcast Group and Sinclair Digital Solutions are dedicated to making Sinclair a communications powerhouse! We are the largest and most diversified television broadcasting company in the country. Sinclair owns and operates, programs or provides services to?more television stations than anyone and?has affiliations with all major networks.?Sinclair Digital group is focused on bringing the most engaging content to web, mobile and over-the-top broadcasting to audiences all over the country!? Our success is the result of extraordinary employees and an exemplary management team who believe in a vision and are dedicated ensuring a great future for our employees. ?Whether you are an industry veteran or a just starting out, you can find it at Sinclair! ?We are advancing the world of Broadcasting and we want YOU to join our winning team!

We are looking for a VP of Marketing for our Corporate Offices. We work in a dynamic and collaborative environment, and the VP of Marketing will interact daily with executives and company leaders, this includes planning, training, budgeting and managing all marketing functions. ?

Responsibilities
  • Develops and leads comprehensive marketing strategy, with the goal of driving revenue growth together with consistent branding across all Sinclair platforms.
  • Assemble a best-in-class performance marketing team to deliver, implement, and measure performance on marketing efforts.
  • Build and execute a rigorous discipline of analytics and measurement systems to quantify the effectiveness of all marketing and customer satisfaction efforts
  • Provide input and significantly influence the direction of our marketing and competitive strategies as well as create advertising and promotional campaigns

Job Description

Company is hiring a?Vice President, Marketing?to lead our multi-channel marketing efforts. Reporting to our Chief Operating Officer, the ideal candidate is a data-driven marketer who will take charge of our entire marketing funnel. The Vice President, Marketing manages both our digital/e-commerce channels as well as our retail, campus-based channels.?This is an ideal role for a hands-on marketer and leader with a track record of category-leading results across online and offline channels, including SEM, display, email, social media, affiliate and direct marketing. ?
Responsibilities
  • Manage an energetic team with a range of professional experience levels to execute flawlessly every day. This is not a hands-off role ? you must be excited to coach and train your team. Plan on 3-4 direct reports and 7-8 total FTEs

Job Description

The Vice President of Marketing for Company is an exciting opportunity to be a part of a highly successful organization that has a rich heritage and a very bright future.?

Reporting to the President of Company, this role will lead Marketing and Commercial sales and be a strategic executive leader in an innovative, double-digit annual growth business.?

Top candidates will have significant experiences in product development, brand building, and multi-channel marketing across multiple countries for a global, hard goods business.? A key challenge is reaching and influencing skilled trades at the purchase decision point.?

Scope of the Position

The Vice President of Marketing:?
  • Reports to the President of Company America, and works in collaboration with the other members of Company?s executive and leadership teams on strategic priorities.?
  • Develops and executes clearly defined omni-channel marketing, advertising and communications strategies that supports consistent business growth and enhances Company?s leading brand equity and awareness, resulting in increased sales and operating profit for all product groups.?
  • Plays an instrumental role in helping Company achieve its Strategic Priorities of?Drive Sustainable Growth, Product / Technology / Innovation Leadership, Operational Excellence, and Become a Talent Magnet?
  • Is directly responsible for Marketing and Commercial business team leadership to meet Company?s Annual Plan and long-term business goals.?
Primary Duties

MARKETING PLANNING AND EXECUTION?
  • Create, manage, coordinate and execute all marketing strategies and implement tactical plans that meet and exceed annual and mid-term plan commitments.
  • Develop and implement a cohesive marketing plan within budget to increase brand awareness and result in improved product sales.
  • Develop unique value propositions, business partnerships, as well as call to action-oriented advertising targeted toward key customer segments that increase brand awareness and sales.
  • Identify, interpret, and capitalize on marketing trends?
  • Perform rigorous analysis on marketing efforts to determine success and failure rates and make adjustments to maximize ROI, including use of benchmark criteria to measure the efficiency and effectiveness of marketing programs, and report regularly to the Executive Team.
  • Conduct internal and external analyses to identify trends, opportunities, and risks.
TEAM MANAGEMENT?
  • Coach, mentor, and motivate the Marketing and Commercial teams, and raise the teams? ability to deliver and exceed expectations.?
  • Identify and guide the development of internal talent for key jobs company-wide.?
  • Evaluate and refine the Marketing and Commercial teams? structure and staffing to ensure that the organization is able to accomplish Company?s goals and objectives.
MARKETING SUPPORT?
  • Create a Marketing Calendar to include marketing and lead generation campaigns, media placements and events.
  • Produce content for lead generation campaigns, and press releases.
  • Create product positioning strategies.
  • Research and analyze economic trends, buying habits, and demographic characteristics of diverse consumers, their tastes and preferences for Company products and those of competitors.?
  • Work closely with Innovation / Product Development, Sales and other Senior Management to create demand and recognition for Company and its products.?
  • Manage the Company E-Marketing Group and electronic media.
Knowledge
  • An undergraduate degree in Marketing or business-related area is required. An MBA is highly desirable.
  • Minimum of 15 years? experience working in Marketing for a global or international organization, and currently be the chief Marketing leader or a strong number 2 position in that organization.
  • Strong background of demonstrated positive leadership who earns respect, with the ability to build high-performance teams as well as to collaborate cross-functionally.
  • Has?held progressive Marketing management roles across a range of functional areas, including strategy, digital marketing, PR / advertising, sales promotion, branding, product placement, analytics / research and channel marketing.
Abilities
  • Strong strategic, analytical and project management skills, ability to make difficult decisions, and a solid knowledge of Search Engine Optimization (SEO), web analytics and tools such as Google Adwords.
  • Culturally adaptable and be able to apply knowledge base and expertise to Company situations and culture.
Skills
  • Experience in the implementation and communications of a consumer hard goods brand that created interest, demand and recognition for products is required.
  • Experience designing and implementing successful channel marketing programs that influenced key stakeholders in the supply chain in a dual (two-step) distribution model company is required.
  • CRM and direct sales experience working in a commercial B2B company is desired.

Job Description

Job Description

The VP, Marketing is responsible for driving revenue growth for the Company Document Business through the creation, implementation, and monitoring of marketing strategies in support of our overarching goals.? This role will have an intense focus on demand generation, audience segmentation and targeting, lead nurturing, scoring and management, creative content development and social media strategy and engagement.
The ideal candidate must be a data-driven, growth-oriented, cross-team contributor with practical experience across all marketing functions but expertise in demand-generation.? This position requires an individual with a creative approach, the desire to drive-growth above all else, and the ability to partner with Sales leadership to build a scalable revenue engine.? We?re looking for a passionate and proven leader with a firm grasp of the latest digital and direct marketing strategies, product marketing chops, and category & brand development experience gained in a B2G or B2B environment.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead a team that generates a steady, growing stream of leads each and every month.
Designing and executing (or overseeing execution of) end-to-end marketing campaigns, from broad-based to niche ABM
Attract, hire and develop an exceptional team as we build a high performing demand generation engine
Redefine and manage our brand strategy, core messaging for Company for Business
Solid working knowledge of the digital advertising ecosystem
Develop and execute a comprehensive strategic and tactical marketing plan that drives rapid growth in customer acquisition.
Define and execute a thought leadership plan that positions Company as an expert in key market categories
Create and constantly improve processes that drive and optimize marketing and lead generation productivity
Monitor customer, market and competitor activity and provide feedback for the product roadmap and identify opportunities, threats and key issues
Build, manage and mentor the people and resources that execute these plans constantly optimizing for best results
Supervise staff by motivating, coaching and consistently providing feedback
Work hand-in-hand with the Sales organization to ensure that company revenue targets are being achieved or exceeded
Developing partnerships across the organization to identify, launch and refine demand generation strategies. This will include working with sales, customer success and product
Work closely with the client success team to ensure long-term, customer satisfaction and strong renewal rates
Track, monitor and report key performance metrics to identify opportunities for improved marketing efficiency
Provide detailed, accurate and predictable lead generation forecasts
Implement infrastructure and systems to support the success of the marketing organization
Brainstorm and nurture new and innovative growth strategies
Effectively drive and manage projects across work streams, accounts and business units
Think strategically and actively contribute to Company?s long-term vision and success
SKILLS AND MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

5+ years? experience at the executive level in a B2B marketing role at a SaaS/software company(ies) with a wide knowledge of the full marketing stack and in-depth knowledge of demand generation, content marketing and product marketing.
Successful experience building a go-to-market strategy and marketing plan in an entrepreneurial environment; Ability to optimize a marketing budget and make every dollar count.
Understanding of lead generation strategy and tactics and use of tactics to create preference and drive conversions on the path to purchase
Proven ability to develop and grow a successful marketing team
Broad marketing skills - mastery of lead generation and content product marketing techniques
Product marketing knowledge and understanding of the product development lifecycle
Finance knowledge including concepts of P&L, forecasting and budget management
Strong leadership skills and a commitment to building a positive company culture
Metrics-driven management style; Knows the numbers and focused on constant and never-ending improvement; Consistent track record of achieving or exceeding marketing targets
Proven experience in working with B2B brands, particularly in the digital space
Knowledge of key platforms and channels for B2B marketing, including but not limited to social media, paid media, email and others
Solid research, response, and reporting skills in the context of lead gen media (understanding of CPL, CPM, CPC)?

? ?Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Marketing or a related field?

Job Description

What You?ll Do:
Reporting to Company?s Chief Marketing Officer and directly matrixing into the President of K-12 Education, the Vice President of Marketing will lead the development and execution of clearly defined SaaS-based marketing and communications strategies in a manner that measurably supports the achievement of business targets while enhancing product loyalty and brand awareness.
  • Lead all marketing functions to drive K-12 revenue growth, including brand, product, digital, event, and partnership marketing disciplines
  • Own accountability for the creation and enterprise-wide execution of a cohesive marketing strategy that reflects core K-12 sales objectives and how to pull marketing levers to drive measurable K-12 revenue growth across key product lines
  • Drive data-driven decision making, leading against a set of defined and broadly understood KPIs that measurably accelerate recurring revenue expansion across Field Sales, Inside Sales, Partner Success, and Professional Development, supporting K-12 student/educator impact
  • Embrace full accountability for leading the marketing team (both direct reports and those matrixing into the role), ensuring highest level of functional expertise, professionalism, service and flawless execution of revenue-driving marketing tactics
  • Facilitate strategic, consistent, proactive communication across the DE leadership team, working in close collaboration with the President of K-12 Education and sales leaders to ensure marketing strategies are developed in alignment with sales priorities
  • Ensure field sales teams are trained on the effective use of DE programs, content and experiences as part of the sales and renewals process to deepen district engagement and build DE brand loyalty
  • Anticipate business cycles and marketplace dynamics to strategically deploy marketing solutions, building skills within the team to do the same
  • Lead the strategic use of technology-based solutions that empower marketing solutions to scale reach, impact and quantifiable results
  • Guide the development of KPIs/metrics to measure efficiency and effectiveness of all marketing activities
  • Manage budgets for all areas of responsibility ensuring marketing supports DE?s ability to deliver on annual profitability targets, including continuously targeting areas for cost savings and greater efficiency?
  • Lead and manage business with the highest ethical standards
Specifically, the Vice President of Marketing will be responsible for leading, planning, organizing, staffing, and training the marketing functions aligned to drive K-12 product revenue growth, in order to achieve profitability objectives while ensuring a consistent marketing message and position aligned with our mission. You will work closely with our Chief Product Officer and marketing team to shape strategies that drive product understanding, engagement, adoption, and usage across all marketing channels. Regular interaction with the senior leadership team, especially the President of K-12 Education and related sales and marketing leaders, will provide meaningful insight to ensure marketing strategies are aligned to optimize revenue growth and profitability.
You will lead direct reports and matrixed teams to continuously improve quality, efficiency and effectiveness, managing all members to consistently meet or exceed business targets. In alignment with Company?s people-focused culture, you will support, coach and develop all team members to ensure company, team and individual success.
Who You Are:
  • 10+ years of progressive SaaS marketing experience at the senior management level, leading multidisciplinary marketing teams overseeing strategy and demand generation for industry and vertical businesses, new product launches, client lifetime marketing and planning
  • Preference given to candidates with experience leading tech-savvy marketing teams accountable for lead velocity and conversion rate improvement
  • A proven track record of performance excellence meeting targets and objectives
  • Excellent writing and editing skills, with attention to details as well as the ability to distill complex and technical issues and ideas and organize them into meaningful message
  • Strategic thinker with ability to develop and implement actionable plans with measurable results
  • Proven ability to effectively communicate and lead at all levels of a corporate organization
  • The ability to articulate a vision and strategy in a way that inspires and motivates a team and focuses their energy on achieving business goals
  • The ability to manage multiple, complex priorities within demanding timeframes
  • Experience in startup, entrepreneurial environments a plus
  • Must have the legal right to work in the United States
  • Must be willing to travel as needed

Job Description

COMPANY is the leading manufacturer of unsaturated polyester, vinyl ester and specialty resins, gel coats, colorants and putties under the CoREZYN ? and Silmar ? brand names for the composites, cast polymer, and solid surface industries.?As a pioneer of innovative technology, we grow to meet the needs of the composites industry.?In addition, all of our manufacturing facilities and research and development laboratories are ISO 9001:2008 and ISO 14001:2004 certified.
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced leader of business teams to be our Vice President of Marketing.? This position will be a member of the senior executive team reporting directly to the COO, and will oversee internal Business Managers who lead specific business segments.? This individual will not only execute in the trenches, but also provide strategic leadership from a market and product-line perspective to our management team, as wells as shaping the company?s strategic planning process.
Major Areas of Accountability:
  • Develop and implement cohesive business plans in targeted markets and business segments to achieve goals in both revenue and profitability.
  • Set current and long-term goals for individual business teams.
  • Manage the entire pricing process in design and execution.
  • Prioritize resources in R&D and product development to support business plan achievement.
  • Work closely with the VP of Sales to align sales and marketing tactics to the business plan.
  • Prepare regular reports and presentations on business performance to the COO.
  • Conduct market analyses to identify new opportunities for growth in new or existing business segments.
  • Identify competitor strategies and devise positioning and counter-strategies to exploit Interplastic strengths.? Maintain the competitive intelligence database.
  • Build long term relationships with key clients as well as industry and government officials and stakeholders.
  • Provide guidance and ideas to organize effective marketing events.
  • Participate in the Interplastic strategic planning process.
  • Serve as the process knowledge expert in value capture and market management for IP Corporation as a whole.
Ideal Candidate:
  • BSc in business or technical concentration in chemistry or engineering.
  • Proven experience leading a business unit or units with direct accountability for revenue and profitability.
  • Demonstrated ability to devise strategic plans and tactical execution to take business unit performance to higher levels with dramatic results.
  • Experience with CRM software and digital marketing tools and techniques.
  • Strong analytical and project management skills.
  • Critical, strategic mindset with ability to make difficult decisions in a real time environment.

POSITION:Vice President, Human Resources

REPORTS TO: John Klein, President EFCO and Curtis Dobler, CHRO Apogee

DEPARTMENT: Human Resources

LOCATION: Monett, MO

About EFCO

EFCO Corporation is a leading manufacturer of architectural aluminum window, curtain wall, storefront and entrance systems for commercial architectural applications. Headquartered in Monett, Missouri, our mission is to be the most trusted supplier in commercial architecture. We seek to provide customers with the highest level of quality, innovation, value, and service.

EFCO Corporation is part of Apogee Enterprises, Inc. (NASDAQ: APOG), founded in 1949 and headquartered in Minneapolis, MN. Apogee is a growing, profitable company with annual revenues approaching $1.5 billion. It provides distinctive metal and glass solutions for enclosing commercial buildings, and glass and acrylic solutions for picture framing and display applications. Companies in the Apogee family are Alumicor, EFCO, Harmon, Linetec, Sotawall, Tru Vue, Tubelite, Viracon and Wausau. www.apog.com

General Description

The Vice President, Human Resources will be responsible for providing strategy, leadership, and functional guidance for all human resource activities including but not limited to, leadership development and succession, performance management, employee/labor relations, compensation and benefits, recruiting and retention, occupational health, payroll, training and development, human resources policy, and management and diversity efforts. As a member of EFCO leadership team, this individual will partner with his/her peers in providing counsel, guidance, and support for their various business plans and needs.

This role will support an HR team of 17 people in the execution of these responsibilities. The role partners with the appropriate Apogee HR Centers of Excellence (COE) such as Compensation, Benefits, Employee Development and Staffing to develop and execute programs that ensure the effective acquisition, development and leadership of talent in the business, consistent with the core values and processes of the overall Apogee enterprise.

Responsibilities
  • HR Strategy Development. In support of the EFCO leadership team, develop and execute HR strategies in support of business strategic plan (STRAP) and annual operating plan (AOP) in the areas of talent acquisition, performance management, learning & development, compensation, employee engagement and organizational development. Work with client groups to:
  • Drive a culture of growth, meeting commitments, and positive employee relations
  • Improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the organization at all levels (e.g., evaluation of cost, clarifying roles and responsibilities, organization design, etc.).
  • Work with the client leadership team to continually monitor performance of the organization and make adjustments to improve the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the team.
  • Work with the business leadership team to implement consistent and meaningful leadership management operating system (MOS) and communication processes that supports the culture, business objectives and mission of the business
  • Work with leadership on strategies to increase employee engagement and commitment
  • Talent Assessment and Development. Conduct organizational talent assessments; continually drive improvements in talent development and acquisition at all levels.
  • Lead the Management Resource Review (MRR) process for the EFCO business, and participate in the annual cross-business unit MRR review to facilitate the sharing and development of leadership talent
  • Work with leadership to manage/develop talent development programs/practices (mentoring, leadership development programs, talent assessment, etc.)
  • Work to develop effective talent acquisition processes at all levels
  • Ensure the appropriate staffing of Manufacturing operations across the business
  • Effective HR Execution. Work with the HR Centers of Excellence (COE); and Apogee HR leadership team to ensure the aligned and effective delivery of HR support/services to the business and functions.
  • Provide sound advice and counsel to management on all employee relations matters
  • Ensure flawless execution of staffing processes for all levels within the business and develop staffing strategies to ensure a robust pipeline of quality candidates
  • Effectively manage payroll and occupational health activities for the business
  • Program manage key HR initiatives within the business (compensation program development, productivity programs, key staffing initiatives, process standardization, etc.)
  • Staff and develop a strong HR business partner and administrative team for the business. Support their growth and development.
  • Compliance with federal and state laws pertaining to all human resource matters, including affirmative action and EEO requirements
Personal Attributes

The successful candidate will be expected to be a high-energy, creative and resourceful self-starter who demonstrates leadership skills and instincts. He/she is highly intelligent and enthusiastic with a commitment to excellence. In terms of personal competencies, the successful candidate must be a hands-on person who possesses the best combination of strategic thinking and drive to achieve tangible business results. In addition, he/she should possess the following competencies:
  • Leadership Development Skills: Deep understanding and experience with the ability to practically apply, as well as coach others to do so.
  • Functional Leadership: A confident, mature person with the ability to connect and inspire others. A proven track record of leading projects and teams that successfully achieve milestones and complete deliverables. Experience managing in an environment that continuously prioritizes operational excellence.
  • Results-Oriented: A driver who possesses the ability to take actions and implement effective solutions in a timely manner often while influencing across different functions and levels of the organization
  • Problem Solver: A creative yet pragmatic problem solver. Methodical and hands-on as well as detail-oriented
  • Analytical Thinking and Decision-Making: A "conceptualizer" of business strategies and objectives who can then integrate that thinking into HR strategies. Excellent planning, execution and project-management skills. Strong business acumen, "street smarts" and an in-depth understanding of the HR and financial implications of business decisions.
  • Teamwork and Interpersonal Skills: A team player and builder, receptive to ideas from others. Shares information and keeps team members and partners informed. Works effectively with others to identify and resolve issues. Excellent interpersonal skills and an ability to interact successfully with all levels of management as well as a diverse work force. Ability to understand and add value to high-level management interactions.
  • Ethics: Highest level of professional integrity and honesty as well as personal credibility.
Education & Experience

Education:
  • Undergraduate degree
  • A master's degree or MBA in Human Resources or Labor Relations (Preferred)
Experience:
  • 10-15 years of experience in Human Resources
  • Minimum four (4) years HR leadership experience, including support of senior leadership at a business and/or functional level
  • 5 plus years in senior functional leadership role supporting Manufacturing, with demonstrated success managing, staffing and driving productive engagement with hourly product staff. Successfully managed hourly turnover and improve the effectiveness of front-line supervisor staff.
  • Experience supporting multiple locations
  • HR COE experience (Compensation, Benefits, Staffing, Organizational Development) (Preferred)
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Job Description

Responsibilities
Reporting to the SVP Finance / CFO, the VP of FP&A will be responsible for all financial planning activities and relationships of the company. As a key member of the management team, he or she will participate in all significant business, operating, and strategic issues. Importantly, this individual will assure that the Company maintains the strong financial forecasting infrastructure required to support continued rapid growth.

  • Develop effective reporting package through coordination with other departments such as IT, HR, and operating departments within the business.?

Qualifications

He/she will be a hands-on leader who is actively involved in the day-to-day financial planning and analysis details of running the business.

Must be eligible to work in the U.S.

Professionals in the areas of legal, business, tax, accounting, finance, audit, risk, compliance and healthcare rely on Company's market leading information-enabled tools and software solutions to manage their business efficiently, deliver results to their clients, and succeed in an ever more dynamic world. Company combines deep domain knowledge with specialized technology. Our portfolio offers software tools coupled with content and services that customers need to make decisions with confidence. Every day, our customers make critical decisions to help save lives, improve the way we do business, build better judicial and regulatory systems. We help them get it right.

job.position: Vice President of Finance and Chief Financial Officer (CFO)
job.description:
Job Description

About Lesley University: Located in Cambridge, Massachusetts, Lesley University is highly regarded for its undergraduate and graduate programs in education, the arts, and applied social sciences. Lesley fosters a highly creative environment in which innovative ideas thrive, theory is integrated with practice and its 6,400 students and 92,000 alumni are empowered to improve and enrich communities. Lesley University prides itself on its commitment to student learning, creating a diverse and inclusive community, and excellence in teaching and mentoring. Lesley seeks to have a culture of mutual respect, collaboration, joint problem-solving, transparency, and honest and helpful two-way communications. We offer a competitive benefits package that includes health, dental, life, and long-term-disability insurance. In addition, we offer generous amounts of vacation and holiday time, as well as a tuition remission policy that enables employees to expand their knowledge and skills. Job Description: The Vice President of Finance and Chief Financial Officer (CFO) reports to the President and serves as a key advisor to the Board of Trustees and a liaison to the Finance, Investment, and Audit Committees of the Board. The individual brings visionary leadership and serves as the strategic financial partner of the president and university leadership, and provides strategic direction to university constituencies with respect to financial affairs. The CFO is responsible and accountable for all financial planning, financial analysis, and financial strategy implementation across Lesley University. The CFO directs the financial vision of the University in alignment with its mission and objectives, evaluating the University's financial performance with respect to long-term operational goals, budgets, and forecasts. The CFO works closely with University leadership to develop strategies, including realignment of existing resources and identification/development of new revenue sources, to realize the vision articulated in the Lesley 2030 Futures Document and achieve the University's strategic goals. The CFO is the primary financial risk manager and financial advisor for the institution, leading implementation and effectiveness of financial information systems and other control systems; affirming compliance with contractual financial obligations; and managing the liquidity and investment of University funds to optimize cash flow and minimize financial risks. This role is also directly involved in managing the University's endowment and investments, the employee retirement plan, and bond financing. Other essential functions of the role include responsibilities for area internal operations and external compliance. The CFO oversees several functional areas of service, including budget and financial planning, information technology (IT), accounting systems and controllership functions, financial management insurance and financial risk management, and payroll and procurement. The position is a key strategic, leadership, and managerial role at the University and is a key contributor to identifying resources and solutions that will help propel the university forward. Essential Functions: Strategy, Planning, and Management Assess and evaluate financial performance through strategic financial modeling with regard to long-term operational goals, budgets and forecasts. Provide insight and recommendations regarding both the short-term and long-term plans of the University. Execute necessary strategies and monitor the outcomes to achieve stated goals. Engage with Senior Leadership Team (SLT) and other colleagues from across Lesley. Establish yearly financial objectives that align with the University's plan for growth and expansion. Particular key areas of collaboration include: partnering with the Provost and deans on all financial aspects of academic affairs; working with the VP for Strategy and Implementation on the ramifications of Lesley 2030, Lesley's strategic plan; working with the VP of Enrollment Management to understand, develop and oversee enrollment projections and financial aid strategies; and working with the VP of Advancement and staff on tracking and reporting of gifts. Strategic Financial Analysis, Budgeting, and Forecasting Develop forward-looking models based on analysis of investment needs, cost and revenue structures, and potential ROI. Apply preferred model to help drive strategic decision-making for the University's plans, current operations, and needs based on evaluation of findings. Develop multi-year budgets to promote financial stability and factor in changes in enrollment as new academic offerings are developed. Identify, develop and execute decision-making based on analysis of business initiatives, program launches and/or new course offerings. Collaborate in evaluating new program/projects, culminating in financial feasibility studies and offering analysis of potential for success and ROI. Monitor trends in higher education affecting the financial well-being of the university and the university's position vis a vis financial equilibrium. Information Technology (IT) Oversee IT and systems needs. The CFO will play a key role in setting the vision for the unit's positioning within the University, both immediately and longer-term. Work with IT to build capacity to support emergent University needs in strategic planning, business modeling support, and data analytics. In tandem with CIO, lead efforts to upgrade and enhance the role of technology and systems support across the University with respect to needs for learning and teaching. Internal Operations Facilitate cultural shift among all reporting units to ground operations in strategic financial analysis in addition to budgeting and accounting principles. Oversee cash, investments and asset management functions. Explore new investment opportunities and provide recommendations on potential returns and risks. Manage cash flow planning process and ensure funds availability. Risk Management and External Compliance Responsible for annual insurance renewals and on-going day-to day insurance claims; this includes a risk assessment associated with the University's coverage. Oversee banking relationships and assess the investment performance of fund managers. Represent University to banks, financial partners, other institutions, donors, public auditors and rating agencies such as Standard and Poor's. Requirements: Proven track record for visionary leadership during organizational growth. Demonstrated strategic mindset, including excellent analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills. Outstanding leadership ability, including communication and presentation skills, confidence, and executive presence, including the ability to manage and motivate staff. An open, collaborative and engaging management style that builds strong relationships both across the campus and throughout the surrounding communities. Strong knowledge of strategic financial modeling, analysis, and scenario planning. Ability to establish metrics tied to financial and institutional strategies, monitor progress towards them, and drive desired results. Proven experience in evaluating and coordinating with a CIO/IT department to manage and/or upgrade accounting and enterprise systems. 10 years of progressive experience in accounting, finance or budgeting providing strategic financial leadership in a complex organization. Bachelor's degree required. Must be authorized to work in the United States; if you hold a visa, your visa status must allow you to work at Lesley University. Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree in finance or related area. Systems implementation experience. 5-years of experience as a CFO in a complex organization, preferably in higher education. Experience in reallocating resources, reducing expenditures, and finding new sources of revenue. Familiarity with national trends and best practices in higher education finance, including current strategies in enrollment, tuition discounting, and other drivers of cost and revenue. Knowledge and understanding of GAAP, IFRS, SOX compliance, SEC reporting and tax form 990 as well as experience working with external auditors, internal controls, and compliance-related issues. Demonstrated cultural competency and working style that will further the University's commitment to Inclusive Excellence. Additional Information: Background checks are required for all positions. Lesley University is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and is committed to increasing the diversity of the university community and the curriculum. Candidates who believe they can contribute to this goal are encouraged to apply. Application Instructions: A cover letter, CV/resume, and contact information for three references must be included for full consideration. Applications will be reviewed upon the establishment of an appropriate pool of candidates.

job.description:
Job Description

Our company culture is the #1 reason people choose to work here, and stay once they're here.? It'd be a mistake to say that things like our fun quarterly events, our no-dress-code, and our efficient 40 hour work week define our culture - they're the positive side effects of our culture.? Our culture is built on good people who love their work, and work hard and intelligently to produce great results.? We're grateful for the work we all do, and we tell each other that.? We are a group of thoughtful, helpful people with integrity, and we get stuff done.? When you have that, it doesn't really matter what clothes you wear or if you booked a 80 hour workweek (which we recommend against doing).
Are you interested in putting together your own software engineering team, building the architecture for a widely distributed software product, and working directly with company founders to create first-ever products Are you able to build a team to support these products, and tie the products into the organization as a whole for world-class data analysis
We?re a people-first, culturally-focused company that drives at real results. If you?ve got the experience of putting together a great team and executing on challenging product vision, and thrive in an environment with little bureaucracy - you?ll make a great impact here. If you?re looking for an easier gig, or one where there?s a wide and deep team already in place and you?ve just got to ?not mess it up? - do not apply to this job.
Our Core Values
It's important to know what core values we care about here, and what we're trying to do as a company. Our vision is to make products that people love, and a company people love to work for. How we get there is through our? 'core values ':
Help '?each other, and allow others to help you
Have? 'Integrity '?in everything you do
Be a? 'thoughtful '?person, and be thoughtful in your work
Execute '! We want people who deliver on goals and promises.
About This Opportunity:
Title:? 'VP of Engineering
Compensation:? '$150k-$175k (depending on experience)
Benefits:?Health care, dental, short and long term disability, life insurance, substantial maternity and paternity leave
Reports To: '?Co-Founders
What does a VP of Engineering?do, anyway
Our fast-growing company utilizes a wide range of technology to drive our products and support our customers around the world. This leadership-level hire will work closely with the co-founders, and be accountable for the execution of their vision - including planning and architecture, product development and design, security, availability, and building a team. The primary existing tech product you?ll be working with is RapidCut - this amazing platform, which is currently in use in 700+ retail locations in over 45 countries, is a cloud-connected 2D cutting plotter that allows our retailers all over the world to make our line of mobile accessories in seconds at the store. In addition, we?re building even more status-quo challenging hardware and software products over the next several years.
Reporting to the co-founders, you?ll have an IT Manager and several outsourced developers reporting to you, as well as the ability to build an internal and/or external team as you see fit. This position will not have to deal with internal IT / and internal help desk items, and will only be working on revenue-producing associated tech projects.?
In plain terms, here?s what this usually means:
  • Create and maintain a tech roadmap with clear prioritization, while keeping the tech team focused on the goal.
  • Recruit, build, and manage a team, both internally and externally, to execute the vision of the co-founders.
  • Look around corners to ensure the platforms, architecture, and systems are adequate for the stage and growth plans of the company.
  • Set and capture metrics that measure the success of the tech team and products.
  • Work closely with the leadership team to take all areas of the business in to account,?including Marketing, Sales, Finance, Operations, and Product R&D.
  • Identify and leverage, when appropriate, new technologies and products
  • We are a company that ships, so doing all the above on-time, on-budget, and in a way that?drives true, usable value for our team and our customers is critical. Until it ships and?customers love it, it doesn?t count.
  • A deep understanding and experience of what makes a great company culture, and?building/leading your team in line with our Core Values.
  • Hands-on technical leadership, including application architecture design, code reviews,?release responsibilities, production support, etc.
If this sounds like you, your previous education, work experience, and passions probably sound like this:
  • 5+ years serving in a leadership position, managing a tech team at a company with scale (non-startup)
  • 2+ years as a software engineer, developer, coder, or similar
  • 3+ years proven work experience and success as a project manager
  • Natural desire to take big hairy problems, rise above the details, and make an actionable plan?that others can carry out
  • Ability to prioritize tasks, and focus a team on a fixed goal to complete projects on time?regardless of unforeseen setbacks
  • Keen ability to look to the future and build processes to prevent avoidable mistakes
  • Ability to spot and document gaps in institutional knowledge that may be living in individuals?heads.
  • Agile, Scrum, and/or other project management certifications
  • College level or higher degree in Computer Science, Computer Programming, Information?Science, Software Engineering, or similar
  • You don?t need to be an expert in all of our tech stack, but you should have expertise in at?least some, with proficiency in many, and the ability to fill in the gaps by learning. Here?s what you?ll find under the hood:
    • Local OS with a move towards containerization (Windows 8.1, Windows 10, with a move towards Linux)
    • Monitoring - Syncro RMM, LogMeIn Central, Splunk
    • Fleet Management Scripting - PowerShell
    • Programming Languages - Node.js, Javascript, C++, ASP.net, HTML/CSS
    • Data Management - MS SQL
    • Version Control - Git, GitHub
    • Infrastructure - AWS
Lastly, here?s what success looks like in this position:
  • The founders of the company serve in visionary tech function only - all management, uptime, development, and tech team day-to-day is 100% off founders? schedule
  • Build and maintain a tech roadmap that reflects founders? visionary goals, as well as your core accountabilities (uptime, new development, etc)
  • A team / system is built to support and maintain our client network 24/7
  • Hire and manage outside tech vendors (developers, support, etc)
  • Hire and manage in-house tech team (developers, managers, support, etc)
  • Product uptime, maintenance, security, and architecture are documented, scaleable, and appropriate for the age and stage of the company
  • Define and drive the metrics that drive accountability of the tech team
  • Organize and maintain code repositories in a central location for all software and websites
  • Up to date, organized, commented, versioned software for our products
  • Software product development is on-time, scalable, reliable, on budget, and achieves?business goals.
  • All software products and websites are in line with founders? vision, and reliably perform their?business functions.

Job Description

Company is working in stealth mode on a unique and innovative form of AAA multiplayer gameplay, leveraging user-generated content and modding. We are looking for a dynamic self driven leader to spearhead this key initiative.
The VP of Engineering is a key role for Manticore as it will help our CTO manage the engineering roadmap, technical leadership, and team. Reporting directly to the CTO, you will develop a strategy to build and scale our platform technology and the team.
This role will require you to have a strong technical background to participate in technology direction and decision making, along with having a product, developer, and people management focused mindset.
Responsibilities:
  • Manage a growing engineering team focused on building our service platform

  • Provide technical and managerial leadership on various potential topics including architecture, live services, security, scalability, backend, etc.

  • Ensure the engineering team has the resources and capacity to meet the company?s ambitious goals
  • Further build accountability and excellence in our engineering culture

  • Ability to build distributed engineering organizations

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field from a top academic institution

Job Description

Company ? Utility Services Group activities include the installation, maintenance and upgrade of communication and utility infrastructure, including, but not limited to: electrical distribution, telecommunications, and natural gas distribution infrastructure.
At Company you?ll be joining a family where we are dedicated to supporting each other and building an atmosphere of teamwork. As part of our team, your opportunities are limitless.
In addition to the valuable skills gained through training and on-the-job experience, Company offers competitive pay, including medical, vision and dental coverage, 401K and employee stock discounts.
We are currently seeking a?Vice President?of Engineering to join our dynamic Team in the Jacksonville, FL area to lead our engineering teams across the country.?
Job Summary
The?Vice President?of Engineering supports the Executive Vice President and has full responsibility and authority for managing and coordinating regional engineering groups. The?Vice President?of Engineering will provide leadership and regional oversight functions by managing, coordinating and developing Company personnel and third party engineering sub-contractors. The?Vice President?of Engineering will operate with significant independence as the principal engineering representative and will meet regularly with senior management of the organization and customers.
The ideal candidate will be able to work cooperatively with other business units and customer representatives and will set the standards for customer service management, engineering design and delivery, planning, scheduling, quality control and all supporting functions necessary to deliver a quality product.
Candidates should have significant experience in the utility construction field, with an emphasis on telecommunications and electrical distribution.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
  • Ensures assigned projects are completed within budgets and schedules while meeting Client needs, business objectives and design guidelines;
  • Establishes and oversees implementation of engineering standards;
  • Oversees engineering and business operations of regional engineering offices;
  • Manages employee training and development programs for engineering functions;
  • In cooperation with the Executive Vice President, develops program and annual budget for regional capital expenditures;
  • Works with Executive Vice President to ensure engineering operations comply with applicable laws and standards;
  • Monitors progress, provides financial control and ensure the quality of projects;
  • Makes presentations to senior management;
  • Responsible for hiring, management and development of all senior staff;
  • Develops responses to engineering RFPs.?
Requirements
  • A Bachelor?s Degree in Civil or Electrical Engineering, or a related applicable engineering discipline;
  • Be currently registered?as a Professional Engineer with the ability to be licensed in multiple states;
  • A minimum of 10 years? related work experience;
  • Demonstrated experience in the design of utility systems for utility providers;?
  • Excellent ability to communicate orally and in writing is essential;
  • Excellent customer service and analytical skills are necessary;
  • Intense attention to details;
  • Must exhibit strong initiative and desire to achieve results and exceed expectations;
  • Must have demonstrated ability to manage complexity and be organizationally and politically astute;
  • Demonstrated ability to build relationships and motivate diverse groups of people;
  • Demonstrated ability to manage staff and a strong understanding of the entire corporate utility infrastructure functions from planning to delivery.

Job Description

Company, a next-generation customer data platform, is revolutionizing how companies like Heineken, The Economist, General Mills, Ancestry.com, and other retail, media, consumer goods, banking, and tech brands execute one-to-one marketing programs that their customers welcome. We're the brain behind the ?right message, right time, right channel?. ?We are driving transformative value for our customers with rapidly increasing demand. We are looking for smart, passionate, and dedicated individuals to grow with us and deliver great value to our customers and company.

Love data, data-science, distributed-systems Our Engineering team builds distributed real-time stream processing of billions of events that involve rich data-science, data transformation pipelines.

To support our growth, we are hiring a top-tier?VP Engineering?to join our team and lead Engineering efforts as we create amazing products.?

What You?ll Be Doing:

We are looking for a great leader with the ability to build, coach and support our top-notch Engineering team. You should have a proven technical background and strong leadership experience.?

Our Tech Stack:?

Company? backend is in Go, and frontend is in JavaScript. We?re using BigTable,BigQuery, ElasticSearch. We use Kubernetes for deployments, Google Cloud Platform for storage, and use stream processing systems similar to Spark and Storm.?

About You:
  • You don?t need to be a product expert in our space but some career experience with marketing technology is a bonus, but not required.
  • You inspire, make tough decisions, and get things done.
  • You are a leader who thrives at the junction of business, product, technology, and team challenges, and who can use the scale of Company today to accelerate growth.
  • You can embrace team needs, assess talent quickly, and pick up velocity.
  • You drive product creation, scaling existing solutions, as part of a collaborative, cross-domain product group and understand the challenges within small companies.
  • You can work with and coach the very, very senior engineering staff with years of deep expertise in this data processing domain.
  • You have a history of experience leading engineering teams in start-up or mid-size companies.
  • You know how to build and improve engineering groups that work on a spectrum of new and creative market-defining products.
  • Immersing yourself in the territory of new markets excites you.
Core traits we expect Engineering Leaders to embody:
  • Focused on solving customer problems and adding value for customers.
  • Data-driven methods?to inform decisions about products, technology, and teams.
  • Substantial?ownership of outcomes and ability to cultivate this trait.
  • Experience leading teams in a?high cadence of development?and strong operational practices.
  • Recruiting and retaining Engineering teams.
  • Expertise in?finding solutions to problems.
Core responsibilities include:
  • Build and develop an exceptional engineering team that delivers with velocity and quality.
  • Develop key internal relationships with the leadership team, peers, and external colleagues.
  • Actively work with customers, field teams, and cross-functional product teams to deliver valuable solutions for customers.
  • Craft and execute best-in-class product development processes.
  • Work with partners outside Company on product, technology, and team innovation.
Core Values we expect our Leaders to embrace and exhibit:?
  • Customer obsessed
  • Always learning
  • Authentic energy
  • We believe in team
  • Be yourself
Education:
  • Bachelors, Masters or equivalent combination of education/experience in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
